loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is 40 years old. She is married with four children. Currently, two of her children are in school. She is a trader who trades in used curtains and bedspreads.  Used curtains and bed sheets are patronized by many people since new curtains and bedspreads are expensive, and with this, Elizabeth has many customers. However, with a small capital, she can barely sell enough to make more profit. She wants the loan to buy more bales of used curtains and bedspreads in different styles and colors to meet the desire of her customers and increase the income for her family.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel A. is 36 years old. She is married with a child who is currently in school. Rachel trades in eggs and has been selling for the past five years to support her family. She treks to big poultry farms to buy her stock of eggs. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy crates of eggs to serve her customers. Rachel hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. She supplies to beverage sellers and other food vendors in her community.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es: El joven Rolando es originario de la aldea Nimasac del Municipio de Totonicapan el comenta que siempre ha tenido la idea de poder construir, el lucho para poderse graduar de perito contador pero anteriormente su actividad es talabartero en el mes de marzo del dos mil nueve consigue un trabajo en una empresa del mismo municipio de Totonicapan, el ve ya estabilidad laboral deside ser realidad sus sueños ya con su profesio. construccion, luego terminar una carrera universitaria
texts.en:
The young Rolando is originally from the village of Nimasa of the Municipality of Totonicapan. He says that he's always wanted to be a builder, but he has been working hard to be an accountant. He used to work as a leather artisan. In the month of March 2008 he landed a job with a company in the Totonicapan. Having steady work he sees the possibility of realizing his dreams and working as a builder, and then finishing his university career.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah K. is 30 years old. She is an unmarried young woman. Hannah has been selling eggs for the past five years. She obtains her supply of eggs from farming communities and supplies them to her customers in Accra. Hannah’s customers are mostly food vendors and people who retail to other customers. She wants to use her loan to buy stocks of eggs to cater to the demands of her customers. She wants to use the proceeds from her operation to add the sale of tomatoes, which she believes, will give her additional income.

loans.use: To buy eggs

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is fifty years old, married, and the mother of six children. She is a resourceful mother and she works with the motivation of supporting her children’s education to provide them with better life opportunity in future. At the moment, two of her children are in school while the rest have completed school and are working.

Janet sells corn dough, which is milled maize grains mixed with water. It is used to prepare local meals like banku (cooked and served with hot pepper or soup) and porridge. Janet wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize to increase her production of corn dough. She supplies mostly to food vendors in her community but she also hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana K. is 32 years old. She is divorced and has one child, who is currently in school. She says selling women's lingerie is very profitable and, therefore, she has been selling lingerie by hawking for two years to support her child’s education. Diana wants to use the loan to buy bales of lingerie to increase her inventory and sales so she can increase her income. She believes this loan will help her save some money to travel to Togo and other parts of the world to buy her stock. Diana hawks and treks to sell her goods.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles O. is 46 years old. He is married and has four children—two are in school and two have completed school. Charles enjoys selling and has been supplying tomatoes to his customers for 15 years to support his family. He treks to farming communities to buy his stock of tomatoes from the farmers. This saves him from the middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to him at a higher price. Charles wants to use the loan to buy tomatoes in bulk to meet the daily demands of his customers. He hopes to use part of his profit to support his last two children in school.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is married and has five children--two are currently in school and the others are independent. She has been selling lace materials, textiles, and clothing materials for five years. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. For lack of adequate working capital, she buys a few stocks of lace materials and then sells them through hawking. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. She takes stock from the central market of Kumasi. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank B. is 27 years old. He is married and has two children who are currently in school. Frank sells mobile phones and accessories. He also sells T-shirts. He says the sale of mobile phones has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires to possess a mobile phone for easy and fast communication. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He requests a loan so he can increase his stock of mobile phones, accessories, and T-shirts. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase savings so he can expand his shop and provide a better education for his children.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Don Carlos es originario de la comunidad de Cojxac del Municipio de Totonicapan actualmente cuenta con dos fuentes de ingreso uno que todos los dias todas las mañanas vende cosa especialmente para damas en su puesto de venta, por las tardes su actividad es ayudante de albañil, los dias domingo sale a vender en el municipio de San Cristobal Totonicapan, hasta la fecha todo le va muy vien en la actualidad esta buscando otro puesto de venda para su esposa y la cual lo esta logrando y por ello necesita de un credito para la compra de mercaderia.
texts.en:
Carlos is from the Cojxac community in the Totonicapán municipality. He currently has two sources of income. Every morning from his place of business he sells things especially for women. In the afternoons he works as an assistant bricklayer. On Sunday he sells in the San Cristobal Totonicapan municipality. Things are going very well for him. He is currently looking for another sales location for his wife. He is setting it up, and he needs a loan to buy the merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard D. is 24 years old. He is single and dependent. Selling used clothing is a very big market in Ghana because brand new clothing is very expensive for the poor. Therefore, selling used clothing has created a market for many men and women like Richard. With the loan, he wants to buy more bales of used clothing to increase his inventory. Richard believes this loan will help him save so he can rent a store to trade in. Presently, he sells in the shade at the market square in his community.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is 29 years old. She is married and the mother of three children and all her children are in the primary level. They live at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana.

Currently Ama sells local rice, rice that is produced in Ghana. She buys a stock of rice from the farmers and bags and sells it to her customers in the community where she lives.

Ama says that, currently, the cost of one bag of rice is very expensive and she desires the loan so as to be able to buy more bags. Her dream is to provide for her children their basic needs so that they can have a sound mind to study in school.

loans.use: To buy a supply of local rice in bulk

loans.name: Nelson Francisco

texts.es: Nelson Francisco Carrión R. tiene la edad de 32 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. El inicio este medio de vida  realizando las ventas de refrescos, naturales y golosinas al principio sus clientes solo compraban sus refrescos pero sus clientes demandaban otros productos, por lo que es así como decide invertir en granos básicos entre otras cosas. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo  para la compra de vitrinas, golosinas, granos básicos. El sueño de Nelson es proporcionarles una vida digna a su esposa y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelson Francisco C. R. is 32 years old and he is a married man. He has 2 children in his care. He runs a grocery store. For the past 6 years he has been running this business. He started out by selling soft drinks, snacks and fresh foods. At first his clients only bought drinks but then they started buying his other items too. He has decided to invest in the purchase of basic grains and other items. The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital, to purchase display cases, snacks, and basic grains. Nelson's dream is to provide a dignified life to his wife and children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A., forty years old, is a married woman with four children. Janet enjoys selling from which she obtains her daily source of livelihood. She is a petty trader who supplies margarine to bakers in her community and other customers in other parts of the country. She has been in business for some time now and, with good customer relations, she has won many customers.

However, Janet buys her supplies on credit at a relatively high price due to lack of adequate working capital. With this loan, she wants to purchase margarine in bulk to serve her customers.

loans.use: To buy margarine in bulk

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace started her fish sales two years ago at Sefwi where she lives. She is now 30 years old and married with three children, who are currently in school.

Grace prepares her goods and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish. Because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She takes delivery of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region and wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fish to make increased sales. That will produce increased income to support her children’s education and her business growth.

She would be grateful for your assistance. It is her dream to save more to build her own house so that her children would not grow to suffer that much.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of smoked fish

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari K., a forty year old trader, is married with four children who are all currently in school.

Selling used clothes has a very big market in Ghana as brand new cloths are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore selling of used clothes has created a business for many men and women.

Omari sells used men’s clothes like trousers, shirts, etc. He hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell in his community. He wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to increase his inventory. He believes this loan will help him save for his children.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Kari Marina

texts.es: Kari Marina S. Hernández tiene la edad de 39 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios surgen por que a Kari le gustaba trabajar, y tenía que ayudar en los gastos de su familia y proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes y los productos de consumo diario. Los sueños de Kari son de ofrecer todo tipo de productos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kari Marina S. H. is 39 years old. She is a married woman and she has 2 children in her care. She has a grocery store business. She has been running this business for the past 10 years. She saw early success because Kari loves to work and she wanted to help out with the family's expenses and wanted to provide her children with an education.

The loan she seeks is to be used as working capital used towards the purchase of basic grains, snacks, detergents and common daily-use products. Kari's dream is to be able to offer every kind of product to her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
Fredrick K. is thirty-eight years old and is married with three children who are all currently in school.

Fredrick trades in eggs and has been selling for the past eight years to support his family. He treks to big poultry farms to buy his stock of eggs and he says it saves him from middlemen who would buy from the farmers and resell to him at higher prices.

Fredrick has been in business for some time now and wants a loan to expand his business. With this loan, he wants to buy more crates of eggs to serve his customers. He hopes to use part of his profit to support his children in school.

loans.use: To buy more crates of eggs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and is the mother of three children. Currently all her children are in school in the community where they live.

Esther is very hardworking and is committed to her business which, she said, is her only source of income. She is a supplier of salt. Salt gives food a very good taste and it is also used to preserve food. She takes delivery of salt from Kumasi which is a nearby city. She buys salt in bags and supplies to her loyal customers in the community market of Sefwi Dwinase where she lives.

Esther is urgently requesting the loan to buy more bags of salt because of the rainy season. She believes she can hoard them during the rainy season and supply to her customers. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of salt to retail in the rainy season

loans.name: Dania Del Rosario

texts.es: Dania del Rosario A. A. tiene la edad de 51 años. Es una mujer casada.  Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su negocio surgió por la búsqueda de un nuevo ingreso, y comenzó a viajar a Managua  en busca de mercadería, por lo que fue muy difícil pues la organización de las compras de los productos era muy difícil ya que algunas veces se equivocaban ciertos productos, por lo que esto le causaba perdidas, pero esto no detuvo a Dania para salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan entre otras cosas. El sueño de Dania es lograr poseer su propia casa y que debido a las circunstancias no ha podido realizar.
texts.en:
Dania del Rosario A. A. is 51 years old. She is a married woman. She has a grocery store business and she has had this business for 5 years. She saw success in her business because she sought out a new source of income and she started travelling to Managua in search of merchandise. She found it very difficult because the orders she placed were sometimes mistakenly filled with other products. She saw some important losses in these events but this didn't stop Dania's will to succeed. The loan she is seeking is to be used as working capital, used toward the purchase of snacks, fresh fruit juices, bread and other items. Dania's dream is to own her home, until now circumstances have not permitted her to be a home owner.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis T. is 29 years old. She is married and is the mother of a child who is still breastfeeding. All her children are currently in school. She lives with her children at Sefwi Dwinase in the western region of Ghana.

Mavis is a baker and bakes bread to supply to her loyal customers. For the past seven years till now, she is been baking bread and other food pastries in order to take care of her household. In spite of the challenges she faces she manages to handle the demands of her customers and successfully meet their requests on time.

Mavis’s only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are shooting up. She requests a loan to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and save more for future eventualities. She said your help is much needed in her life and business.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood

loans.name: Karla Ivon

texts.es: Karla Ivon L. López  tiene la edad de 28 años. Actualmente es una mujer casada. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa usada. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica  a este negocio. Karla inicio colocando sus productos en su vivienda al experimentar que ciertos, clientes llegaban a su casa a ver sus productos, pero por consejos de una amiga decide realizar las ventas de su ropa de manera ambulante, a ciertas personas que son amigas suyas, además algunas veces su hermana sale con ella a vender la ropa. El financiamiento que esta solicitando es para capital de trabajo par la compra de camisetas, vestidos y  pantalones. Su deseo es mejorar los ingresos de la actividad para asegurarle a su hijos el futuro de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karla Ivon L. L. is 28 years old. She is a married woman and she has a son in her care. She owns a used clothing business, which she runs from her own home. She has been running the business for more than three years. Karla started displaying some of her products in her home because some clients used to come to her home to view the items. But following some advice from a friend she started selling her clothing door to door. Sometimes she sells alongside her friends and her sister. The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital, to purchase t-shirts, dresses and slacks. Her wish is to improve her business income so that she can secure her children with a future and be able to send them to school.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 33 years old, married, and a mother with one child. They are a very humble family who want to invest in their future. She lives at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana.

Alice is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tinned tomatoes, bags of rice, etc. In selling these products, she says, they move very fast and you can easily recover your money. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi.

With her three years experience in her business, she wants to add other stuff like maize, eggs and others things that are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this can be possible with the help of loan assistance. Therefore she wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tinned tomatoes, etc. She is much convinced that the loan would help her increase her stock in the event of a price hike.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like cooking oil, bags of rice, spices and tinned tomatoes

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca G. Hernández tiene la edad de 40 años. Es una madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de granos básicos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella decide establecer este negocio porque es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, es por eso que decide vender productos de consumo diario, y comienza a vender jabón, detergentes y refrescos naturales, por medio de una tía decide realiza un financiamiento a Fundación León 2000, y con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio. Y ahora solicita otro financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, frijoles, aceite y sorgo. Su deseo es comprar bodega recoger todos los granos básicos y almacenarlos.
texts.en:
Francisca G. H. is 40 years old, she is a single mother to two children, both of whom are going to school. She sells basic grains and she has been running this business for more than three years. She decided to set up her business because she has an entrepreneurial spirit and she is hard working. She sells common daily-use products, now starting to sell soaps, detergents and fresh fruit juices. Her aunt connected her with Fundacion Leon 2000 (Kiva Field Partner) and with the help of these loans she has seen success in her business. She requires a loan to be used as working capital, to purchase corn, beans, cooking oil and sorghum. Her wish is to purchase a store where she can sell all the basic grains and be able to store them.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is a 38 year old woman. She is married and has four children. All of her children are in community primary school. She is a food vendor, selling rice with gravy stew in the community where she lives. She started her business about four years ago while taking care of her home. Her food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables and bags of rice to increase her efficiency and to produce the food in larger quantities. She believes this will help to expand her business and raise more income to help support and provide for her family and to finance her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat and firewood etc.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa María Juárez M. tiene 59 años de edad. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta y destace de cerdo. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicia este negocio pensando en el bienestar de sus hijos, la idea surgió por una amiga ya que ella le dio la sugerencia, de que se dedicara a este tipo de negocio a la venta de cerdos y con ella asistía a las comarcas para realizar la venta de ellos, con el paso del tiempo fue que decide realzar el destace de cerdo, por lo que la elaboración de los nacatamales no era tan fácil, pero con la ayuda de su amiga aprendió la Elaboración de los nacatamales. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdos y materia prima como masa, e ingredientes entre otras cosas. Su deseo es comprar los suficientes cerdos para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa María Juárez M. is 59 years old. She is married, and has 3 children. Her economic activity for more than 30 years has been selling pork. She started her business thinking about the well-being of her children, and the idea arose because of a friend’s suggestion. Together, they visited the villages to sell their product. Over time, she learned how to butcher the pigs and how to make nacatamales (a local dish) from her friend. The loan she requests is for working capital to buy pigs and dough, ingredients, and other items. Her wish is to buy enough pigs to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 24 years old. She is single and mother to one child who is still breastfeeding. The child's father refused and denied responsibility for the child. She works very hard to take care of her child. She prepares and sells food, such as fried yam and fried ripe plantain, in the community market. She has been in the food production area for three years now. She requests loan support to buy more yams, plantains, vegetables, etc. to prepare the food. She believes that she can save more to provide health care for her child. She also plans to continue her education after her child starts schooling. She has completed senior high school and wants to enter college by next academic year. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy yam and plantain.

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.es: Maria Socorro F. M. con 55 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos donde tres de ellos aun son menores de edad. Maria y su esposo don José de 63 años de edad trabajan en conjunto para sacar adelante a su familia ya que para ellos es importante la educación escolar de sus hijos  y es por ello que estos padres se esfuerzan en su negocio para lograr ganancias dignas que les permitan darle estabilidad a sus hijos, Maria se dedica a la venta de productos varios como toallas de baño, zapatos, cremas para el cuerpo, sabanas para cama entre otros; Maria solicita este crédito por que quiere invertir en mas tollas de baños ya que este es el producto mayor demandado y también para seguir surtiendo su inventario en mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Socorro F. M., 55, lives in the La Libertad department with her husband and five children. Three of her children are minors. Maria and her husband, José, who is 63, work together to get ahead with their family. Their children’s education is important to them. That is why they put so much effort into their business. They do it in order to get decent earnings that allow them to provide their children with stability. Maria sells various products like bath towels, shoes, body lotion, bed sheets, and others. Maria is asking for a loan to be able to buy more bath towels. This is the product with the most demand. She also wants to continue stocking her inventory with merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy towels and stock her inventory

loans.name: Adelayda Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Adelayda del Carmen se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos lácteos como lo son el queso seco, queso fresco, queso mozarela, quesillo, cuajada y crema.

Todos estos productos son ofertados por ella misma a diario y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar sus productos lácteos y así venderlos en su establecimiento el cual atiende desde hace 15 años.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua, Adelayda del Carmen runs her business selling dairy products such as dry white cheese, fresh cheese, mozzarella cheese, string cheese, curd cheese and cream cheese.

She offers all these products herself every day. She has gone to Ceprodel to apply for a new loan to buy raw materials to make her dairy products. This way she can sell them in her establishment which she has run for 15 years.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Karla Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, específicamente en el Mercado Mayoreo, es un lugar donde muchas personas llegan a realizar sus compras a diario y es allí donde la señora Karla V. tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa el cual es comercializada por ella misma y ofrecida a sus clientes.

Actualmente, la señora Karla ha acudido a Ceprodel porque tiene una necesidad como lo es la de adquirir un crédito para la compra de la ropa. Es por este motivo que espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará un crédito para salir adelante y de esta manera mejorará su condición económica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla V. has her own business selling cloths in the city of Managua at a Wholesale Market, where many people go to shop everyday. Ms. Karla is asking for a loan to Ceprodel for the purchase of clothing. She is very confident in getting the support from Ceprodel to succeed and improve her economic status.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es:
FELIPA H. P.
Es la Presidenta D. la Alcom las Violetas, vive en el  AA. HH Villa Violeta MZ H LT 20 distrito D. Comas – Lima, tiene 56 años, es separada D. su esposo, tiene 4 hijos que son independientes, tiene una  nietecita D. 3 añitos D. edad que esta bajo su responsabilidad, es quien le da fuerzas para seguir adelante dice Felipa,  tiene una bodega en su domicilio que ya esta funcionando hace 4 años que poco a poco con los prestamos que  ha ido incrementando en EDAPROSPO ha   mejorado en lo económico y personal, el dinero desembolsado S/ 1,000.00 lo invertirá para surtir su bodega y con lo que le sobra seguirá haciendo mejoras en su casa.
 
La Alcom las Violetas esta conformada por 10 integrantes esta en el III ciclo, ha desembolsado el monto D. s/ 8,400.00, cada socio se dedica a las diferentes actividades como son vta D. CDs, jugo D. naranja, confecciones, vta D. golosinas entre otros, son clientes muy puntuales, responsables se apoyan entre ellos no permiten que caiga ninguno, se sienten identificados con EDAPROSPO porque les  ayudo a mejorar no solo en sus negocios sino también en cuanto a lo económico y personal.  

La  meta D. la Sra. Felipa es reabrir su  Internet que lo cerró por problemas económicos.
texts.en:
Felipa H. P. is President of the Alcom la Violetas, and lives in the district of Comas, in Lima, Peru. She is 56 years old, separated from her husband, and has four independent children. She is responsible for caring for her three year old neice, which she she says provides her with the strength necessary to move forward. For the last four years she has operated a store from her home and, little by little, and with the help of loans from EDAPROSPO, she has improved both her economic and personal status. She will invest the majority of the loan of S/ 1,000.00 [approximately US $340] to further supply her store and, with any leftover money, will improve her home. The Alcom las Violetas is comprised of 10 members, is in its third cycle, and has until now spent a total amount of S/ 8,400.00. Each member is dedicated to a different activity such as the sale of CDs, orange juice and candy, among others. They are very punctual and responsible clients that help each other out and do not allow any individual member to fail. They reached out to EDAPROSPO because the organization supports them not only in improving negotiations but also to improve economic and personal issues. Ms Felipa's goal is to have Internet access again, which was shut down due to economic difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Neyling

texts.es:
Neyling Gutierrez es una dama muy esforzada cuya labor ha sido la venta de productos lácteos como lo son quesos de todo tipo, quesillo, cuajada y crema.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una excelente trabajadora que ha llevado el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación. Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el objetivo de adquirir un crédito para la compra de los productos lácteos para ofrecerlos y seguir vendiendo el mejor queso que a muchas personas les ha gustado.
texts.en:
Neyling Gutierrez is a very hard working lady whose business is the sale of dairy products such as cheeses of all kinds, curd and cream. She has been an excellent worker who has provided for her humble family. She is asking for a loan to Ceprodel that will be used in the purchase of dairy products to offer and continue selling the best cheese that many people like.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Estela Ofelia

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Estela Ofelia M. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de papayas siendo este su negocio al que se ha dedicado con mucho empeño ya que ha sido el sustento de su hogar.

Actualmente, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con un objetivo como lo es el de adquirir un crédito para la compra de las papayas para ofertarlas en su localidad y así seguir aumentando sus ventas y por ende mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Estela Ofelia M. is dedicated to the business of selling papayas at the Wholesale Market in the city of Managua. She has worked hard and this has been the main source of income on her household. She is asking for a loan to Ceprodel, which will be used in the purchase of papayas in order to continue increasing her sales and improve their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria Del Carmen M. de 60 años de edad reside en el municipio de Ciudad Delgado ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Gloria vive sola y se encuentra ya pensionada recibe mensualmente 100$ de su pensión de los cuales ha logrado sacar provecho montado  una tienda con productos de consumo diario que es atendida por ella, en el transcurso del día llega una sobrina de Doña Gloria para acompañarla y ayudarle en el negocio, Gloria solicita este crédito para compra de bebidas ya que no posee variedad de bebidas que los clientes demandan.
texts.en:
Gloria Del Carmen M. de 60 años de edad reside en el municipio de Ciudad Delgado ubicado en el Gloria Del Carmen Martinez is 60 years old and resides in the town of Ciudad Delgado located in the state of San Salvador. Gloria lives alone, is already retired and receives a monthly pension of $ 100, which she has used to start a small grocery shop. She runs the business and gets help from her niece. Gloria is asking for a loan to buy drinks because she does not have the variety of drinks that customers demand.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Victor Enrique

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, capital del bello país de Nicaragua, el señor Victor R. se dedica arduamente a trabajar en su negocio de venta de pollo en piezas y venta de embutidos los cuales son a diario vendidos en su establecimiento donde es visitado por los clientes.

Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y hoy en día ha llegado a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de 700 libras de pollo para continuar ofertándolas porque actualmente se le están agotando y requiere invertir en dichas compras para mejorar su condición actual.
texts.en:
Victor R. works arduously at his business in Managua, the capital of the beautiful country of Nicaragua. He sells chicken pieces and sausages. His customers come to his establishment every day to buy his products. He has been able to get ahead through much effort. He is now asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy 700 pounds of chicken to continue selling them. He is running out of chicken, so he needs to buy more to allow him to improve his current condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken and sausages

loans.name: Carlos Miguel

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua el señor Carlos Miguel L. atiende su negocio de venta de abarrotes y de carne el cual atiende muy atentamente a diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer. 

El motivo por el cual el señor Carlos ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los abarrotes y para la compra de la carne porque a diario sus clientes le visitan para realizar las compras de la carne y por tanto debe de tener el producto para satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos Miguel Lopez has a grocery/meat shop business at a wholesale market in the city of Managua which he attends on a daily basis from early morning until evening. Mr. Carlos Is asking for a loan to Ceprodel for the purchase of groceries and meat that his customers request and this way satisfy the demand.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: La Fuerza Group 3

texts.en:
Suzana M. F., pictured on the far right, is the coordinator of her five-member group. She resides in Las Minas, a small town in the sector of Guaricanos in Santo Domingo Norte. She lives with her husband and three sons aged 17, 14 and 13, all of whom go to school. The eldest is a sophomore in high school, still undecided on a career.

Suzana now owns the cafeteria she has been working at since she was a child. It was passed down to her from her parents, and previously by their parents. In her cafeteria, she bakes and sells cakes, pastries, juices etc. She also specializes in baking wedding and birthday cakes.

This would be Suzana's fourth loan through Esperanza. With it she plans to purchase ingredients such as flour, butter, and sugar in bulk in order to cut down on her costs, which usually scale up quickly when she buys only small amounts every few days. She hopes to continue to grow her business and improve her living conditions. When her children are old enough to go to college (the eldest in just two years) she hopes the income from her business will be able to pay for their education.

One of her long term goals is to continue to push herself in order to provide a better future for her children so they won't have to go through all of the hardships she has gone through.

loans.use: To purchase flour, butter, sugar and other baking ingredients

loans.name: Santos De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Santos de los Ángeles V. de 40 años de edad, reside en el departamento de san Vicente junto a su esposa. Él vende medicinas de forma ambulante en su motocicleta y las comercializa en diferentes pueblos de San Vicente. Santos trabaja diariamente por el sustento de su esposa y suyo y es por esto que solicita un préstamo, con el fin de poder obtener el dinero y comprar más medicinas, las cuales tienen mucha demanda y que le es muy factible venderlas por el bienestar de su hogar ya que le brindan más ganancias.
texts.en:
Santos de los Ángeles V., 40, lives with his wife in the San Vincente department. He sells medicines as a street vendor on his motorcycle. He sells in the different towns of San Vincente. Santos works every day to support himself and his wife. That is why he is asking for a loan to be able to buy more medicines. They are in much demand. It is very practical to sell them for the well being of his household because they give him more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more medicines

loans.name: Candida Maritza

texts.es: Candida Maritza M. reside en el barrio San Juan de Dios en el departamento de San Vicente junto a su único hijo de 13 años de edad. Ella posee una librería en su propia casa, y es un negocio el cual se venden muy bien los productos, ella vende todo lo relacionado con papelería, así también vende camisas y arreglos florales para el hogar. Candida solicita un préstamo a través del cual surtirá más su negocio, ya que como madre soltera trabaja día con día para brindarle una vida mejor a su hijo, es por esto que ella desea mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Candida Maritza M. lives in the San Juan de Dios neighborhood in the San Vincente department. She lives with her only child, who is 13. She has a bookstore in her own house. Products sell very well in the business. She sells everything having to do with stationery. She also sells shirts and floral arrangements for the home. Candida is asking for a loan to better stock her store. As a single mother, she works day to day to give a better life to her son. That is why she wants to improve the condition of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products for her bookstore

location.town: Barrio San Juan de Dios, departamento de San Vicen

loans.name: Mi Progreso Group

texts.es:
M. A. NORMA ELENA
Es la presidenta D. la Alcancía Comunal Mi Progreso, en las mañanas atienD. en su chingana mientras prepara el menú para salir a vender en la puerta D. su casa los deliciosos platos D. ceviche, papa rellena, hígado frito entre otros , luego en la tarD. se prepara para vender sus riquísimas cachangas con café, Norma tiene 46 años D. edad es casada con el Sr. Beder Villanes,  tiene 6 hijos, 3 son independientes, y a 3  apoya en sus estudios con la ayuda D. su esposo, vive en calle 9 D. octubre # 222 A Villa Esperanza distrito D. Carabayllo – Lima, Norma menciona que esta muy agradecida con EDAPROSPO porque con los prestamos que le brinda   a podido educar a sus hijos que hoy en dia son profesionales.

La Alcancía Comunal ha desembolsado con 10 clientes esta en el 2do ciclo D. la 2da fase  el monto desembolsado es  S/ 9,900.00 cada cliente se dedica a las diferentes actividades las cuales son. Comida, productos D. belleza, manualidades, vta D. ropa, artesanía, etc. Cuando uno D. los integrantes esta enfermo o sufre algún accidente todos se solidarizan y apoyan haciendo parrilladas, polladas etc , para que no falle en el pago del préstamo, son unidos, responsables, puntuales, el dinero lo van a invertir en la compra D. mercadería para brindarles mejor atención y fidelizar a sus  clientes.
texts.en:
M. A. Norma Elena is president of the Alcancía Comunal Mi Progreso. In the morning she serves the bar while also preparing the takeout menu which she sells from the entryway of her home. The menu includes delicious plates such as ceviche, stuffed potatoes and fried liver. In the afternoon she prepares her very rich "cachangas" [a desert that is commonly maD. of flour and wheat] that she serves with coffee. Norma is 46 years old and is married to Mr Beder Villanes. They have six children, three of whom are independent, and three of whom she and her husband support with their studies. They live in the Carabayllo district in Lima, Peru. Norma has said she is very appreciative of EDAPROSPO as they loans she has received from them enabled her to educate her older children who are now professionals. The Alcancía Comunal has provided loans for 10 members during this second cycle of the second phase in the amount of S/ 9,900.00. Each client is dedicated to various activities such as food, beauty products, handicrafts, clothing sales, artisanal products. When one of the members is ill or suffering from an accident they come together in solidarity and proviD. support in barbeucing chicken, etc, so that they do not fail in paying back the loan. They are united, responsible, punctual and the money loaned to them will be invested in purchasing merchandise to attract attention for their businesses and foster customer loyalty.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Roxana Lizeth

texts.es: Roxana Lizeth C. Q. de 22 años de edad reside en Lourdes Colón junto a sus dos hijas de 3 años y la menor de 6 meses de edad, su esposo reside en Los Estados Unidos. Ella posee un comedor en el cual realiza desayunos y almuerzos, Roxana trabaja en su negocio al mismo tiempo que cuida a sus hijas, a pesar que su trabajo es muy pesado ella desea seguir adelante con el, ya que es gracias a este que ella puede solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Roxana solicita un préstamo con el fin de obtener el capital necesario para comprar más productos para su negocio así como también materia prima para la elaboración de la comida.
texts.en:
Roxana Lizeth C. Q., 22, lives in Lourdes Colón with her two daughters. One daughter is three years old, and the other one is six months. Her husband lives in the United States. She has a dining room where she makes breakfasts and lunches. Roxana works in her business and takes care of her daughters at the same time. Even though her work is very difficult, she wants to get ahead in it. Thanks to her work, she is able to pay the household expenses. Roxana is asking for a loan to buy more products for her business. She will buy raw materials to make the food.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make food

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Paula Elizabeth

texts.es: Paula Elizabeth R. D. D. D. 41 años D. edad resiD. en Lourdes Colón junto a sus cuatro hijos todos menores D. edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee un salón D. belleza en la cual trabaja diariamente para darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos. Paula solicita un préstamo para mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio, así también poder comprar nuevo producto como Shampoo, cremas y otros productos para el cuidado personal, ella desea crecer más en su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Paula Elizabeth R. D. D. is 41 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón with her four children who are all minors and in school. She has a beauty salon in which she works every day so that she can give her children everything they need. Paula is requesting a loan to improve the conditions in her store and also to be able to buy new products like shampoo, conditioner and other personal hygiene products. She hopes to grow her business more and thus generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new products for her beauty salon

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña María Y. tiene 28 años de edad, es casada de oficios Costurera, “Confección de Blusas” cuenta con un taller de 3 maquinas, habita junto  sus 3 hijas, ella y sus hijas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 18 años de elaborar Blusas en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xenajtajuyup del Cantón ChiY., del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijas, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Y. is 28 years old, married, and has three daughters. She is a seamstress who produces blouses in the three-machine shop she operates from her home, where she works with her daughters and two other employees. She has made use of her sewing skills for the past 18 years. Her business is located in the Paraje Xenajtajuyup del Cantón ChiY. village in the district of Totonicapán, Guatemala.

Now that customer demand has increased, she does not have sufficient capital to expand her business. This is why she has applied for a loan from Asociación ASDIR. She intends to buy raw materials so that she can increase her sales, as well as provide for her daughters and improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es: José Raúl A. de 41 años de edad reside en Ciudad Arce junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo. El posee una ladrillería desde hace muchos años y es un experto en la elaboración de ladrillos, es por esto que posee muchos clientes. José solícita un préstamo para poder comprar materia prima como tierra negra y tierra blanca y leña para la elaboración de ladrillos. José es una persona muy entusiasta que anhela brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia y es por ellos que él obtiene las fuerzas necesarias para trabajar arduamente.
texts.en:
41-year-old José Raúl A. lives in Ciudad Arce with his life partner and son.
He has owned a brick-making business for many years and is an expert brickmaker. This is why he has many customers. José is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials like black soil, white soil and wood to make the bricks.
José is a very enthusiastic person who wishes to give his family the best. They give him the strength to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Brick-making materials

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Isabel Celestina

texts.es: La señorita Isabel C. tiene 21 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios tejedora, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 telares, habita junto a su Mamá, ella y sus Mamá se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un empleado para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío 2do Palemop, Aldea V., del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Isabel C. is 21 years old, single and a weaver by trade. She makes typical women’s clothing in her workshop equipped with two looms. She lives with her Mamá, who also weaves, and they have one employee. She has six years experience weaving at her home at Caserío 2do Palemop, in Aldea V., in the Totonicapán region of Guatemala.
Her customer demand has risen, but her current economic situation is making it difficult for her to increase her capital. This is why she has come to Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. She plans to purchase raw materials that will enable her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicraft materials

loans.name: Santa  Catarina

texts.es: Doña Santa C. cuenta con 42 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes Tipícos para mujeres” habita junto a  sus 5 hijos, ella y sus hijos  se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 12 años en la Artesanía su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Chocanac de la Aldea V., del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas por semana, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Santa C. is 42 years old. She is married and works as a weaver. She manufactures typical cuts for women. She lives with her 5 children who are weavers as well. Santa has been in this craft for 12 years. She lives in Caserio Chocanac in the V. Village at the Totonicapán department in Guatemala. Santa's clientele has recently increased. However, her economical condition is not good enough to allow her to increase her capital. Therefore, she came to the ASDIR Association to request a loan to use it to purchase more merchandise thereby increasing her weekly sales. She also hopes she can help his children succeed and improve her family's life conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (purcahse raw materials)

loans.name: Cristina Isabel

texts.es: Cristina Isabel M. M. de 35 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Paz junto a sus cuatro hijos menores de edad. Ella posee un negocio en la playa el Cuco en el cual vende agua, refrescos, agua de coco, flotadores y collares y pulseras artesanales las cuales ella misma las hace junto a sus hijos. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más productos para su negocio como golosinas y más flotadores, así también desea comprar materia prima para la elaboración de collares y pulseras. Cristina es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual ha salido adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y deseos de superación.
texts.en:
Cristina Isabel M. M. is 35 years old and lives in the department of La Paz with her 4 dependent children. She has her own business on El Cuco beach in which she sells water, soft drinks, coconut water, inflatable floating devices, and necklaces and bracelets that she and her children make. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase more products, such as candy and more floaties. She would also like to purchase materials to make necklaces and bracelets. Cristina is a very hardworking woman who has gotten ahead thanks to her own efforts and her desire for self-improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make necklaces

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es: Doña Catarina Z. cuenta con 52 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y venta de ropas típicas para mujeres”, habita junto  con su esposo y sus hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 10 años en el comercio en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xolcajá del Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Catarina Z. is a 52-year-old married woman who buys and sells traditional women’s clothing. She lives with her husband and children. She and her husband have been in this craft for 10 years, working from their home in the Paraje Xolcajá in the Poxlajuj canton, department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, customer demand has risen, but her financial situation does not allow her to increase her capital, which is why she is turning to Asociación ASDIR for a loan with the intention of purchasing more merchandise. This way, she can boost sales, hoping to be able to help her children get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Marina

texts.es: Ana Marina O. D. P.  D. 40 años D. edad resiD. en Santa Tecla junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ella posee un negocio en el mercado D. Santa Tecla en el cual comercializa carteras para dama, accesorios para el cabello, zapatos entre otras cosas más. Ana Marina es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual se esfuerza a diario por contribuir junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder surtir su negocio y poder obtener mayor demanda en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Marina O. D. P., 40, lives in Santa Tecla with her husband and two children. She has a business in the market in Santa Tecla. She sells women’s purses, hair accessories, and shoes among other things. Ana Marina is a hard working woman. Every day she puts forth effort to contribute, along with her husband, to the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to be able to stock her store and be able to get more demand for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products for her business of selling various products

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano is 57 years old and is a widower. He runs a small lunch catering business from his small farmhouse right outside of town in Urcos, Perú, a location called “Sacred Valley of the Incas”. He currently has contracts with local businesses and individuals to prepare and deliver eighty lunches a day around the main square. A typical lunch costs around $1 and includes soup, a meat dish and a soft drink.

Feliciano has been running his business for two years. With the loan he hopes to add more customers and he eventually hopes to be able to open a restaurant.

Feliciano is part of a communal bank called Qori Orcco that has been working with Arariwa for many years. Each month the members receive financial education from a loan officer, and they also participate in a savings program with Arariwa to help build up their capital. Feliciano and his group are committed to paying their loans according to their repayment schedules.

loans.use: To increase food production to add more clients

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel M. R. reside en Ahuachapán junto a su esposo. Ella posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su casa, la cual le ha proveído para muchos gastos del hogar, es por esto Isabel desea mejorar su negocio solicitando un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital necesario para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y de esta manera poder surtirlo para poder obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Isabel M. R. lives in Ahuachapán with her husband. She runs a store in her home selling staple goods. This business has covered many household expenses and this is why Isabel wishes to improve it. She is requesting a loan that will enable her to obtain enough capital to improve her business and stock her store so that she makes better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple goods

loans.name: Jesús Margarita

texts.es: Doña Jesús C.  cuenta con 39 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes Tipícos para mujeres” habita junto a  sus 5 hijos, ella y sus hijos  se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 12 años en la Artesanía su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Paquiaquix, Cantón Quiaquix del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas por semana, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Jesús C. is 39 years old. She is married, by the Tejedora service. She makes traditional clothing for women. She lives with her 5 children. They all do the same work; she has spent 12 years in crafts. Her home is found in the Paraje Paquiaquix, in Cantón Quiaquix, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. At the moment the demand from her clientele is growing, but the economic conditions that she finds herself in are not sufficient for her to be able to augment her capital. For this reason, she approached ASDIR to ask for a loan, with the intention of buying more merchandise and in this manner increasing her weekly sales, hoping also to improve her children’s lives and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (purchase of raw materials)

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo A. V. de 41 años de edad reside en el municipio de Candelaria en el departamento de Cuscatlán junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos. El posee un taller de estructuras metálicas desde hace 10 años, en el cual ha ido creciendo con el paso de los años, logrando mejorar el estilo e vida de su familia, brindándoles todo lo necesario para ellos. Leonardo solícita un préstamo para poder mejorar su negocio, ya que el desea ampliarlo y cambiar las tuberías de aguan negras debido a que el negocio esta a la par de su casa, así también desea comprar materia prima para el negocio.
texts.en:
Leonardo A. V. is 41 years old. He lives in the municipality of Candelaria, in the department of Cuscatlán along with his wife and their three children. He has had a metal shop for the past 10 years, with which he has grown with the passing of the years, achieving a better style of life for his family, providing everything they need. Leonardo is asking for a loan in order to improve his business, which he wants to expand, and to change the blackwater pipes that are along the side of the house for the business. He also wants to buy raw materials for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel and repair Leonardo's factory

location.town: Candelaria en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: María Regina

texts.es: Doña María C. cuenta con 18 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y venta de Blusas típicas para mujeres”, habita junto  con su esposo y su hijo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 3 años en el comercio en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xolcajá del Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su hijo, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña María C. is 18 years old. She is married and works as a businesswoman, in the Purchase and Sale of traditional shirts for women. She lives along with her husband and her child. She and her husband do the same work, and have spent the past 3 years in business from their home that can be found in the Paraje Xolcajá of Cantón Poxlajuj, in the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, her clients’ demand has grown, but the economic conditions that she finds herself in are not sufficient for her to be able to increase her capital. For this reason, she has approached ASDIR to ask for a loan, with the intention of buying more merchandise and in this manner increasing her sales, hoping also to be able to improve her child’s life, and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Funds

loans.name: Juana Bonifacia

texts.es: La Señorita Juana R. cuenta con 27 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y venta de Blusas típicas para mujeres”, habita junto  a sus Papas, ella, lleva 6 años en el comercio en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas,  y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Miss Juana R. is 27 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She is a merchant “who buys and sells typical women’s blouses”. For six years, she has been running her business out of her home in the village of Caserío Xetinimit de la Aldea de Nimasac in the district of Totonicapán, Guatemala.

Customer demand has increased, but she has insufficient capital to expand her inventory. This is why she has applied for a loan from Asociación ASDIR. She intends to buy additional merchandise so that she can increase her sales and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lucas Agustín

texts.es: Don Lucas C. cuenta con 34 años de edad, es casado de oficios Tejedor, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres”, habita junto  con su esposa y sus hijos, ella y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 10 años en  la artesanía en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje la Planta del Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar más mercadería y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Lucas C. is a 34-year-old married weaver who makes traditional clothing for women. He lives with his wife and children. He and his wife have been involved in this craft for 10 years, working from their home in Paraje La Planta in the Poxlajuj canton, department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, customer demand has risen, but his financial situation does not allow him to increase his capital, which is why he is turning to Asociación ASDIR for a loan, with the intention of purchasing more merchandise. This way, he can boost sales, hoping that he can help his children get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Luisa Simeona

texts.es: La Señorita Luisa Simeona R. T.   cuenta con 45  años de edad, es soltera se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeño Micro Empres  a la que se dedica, lleva 15 años de cómo comerciante en la venta de ropa típicas, para mujeres  y se encuentra en el Caserío Tzan Nimasac municipio y  departamento de Totonicapán Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de poder comprar más mercadería como también, obtener mejores diseños y  también poder satisfacer a sus clientes, sobre la  demanda de sus ventas y así poder mejorar, sus ingresos. Pada poder satisfacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Ms. Luisa Simeona R. T. is a 45-year-old single woman who has owned a small business for 15 years, selling traditional women’s clothing. She lives in the Tzan Nimasac hamlet, in the municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, customer demand has risen, but her financial situation does not allow her to increase her capital, which is why she now turns to Asociación ASDIR for a loan with the intention of purchasing more merchandise. She also wants to obtain better designs and be able to satisfy her customer’s demands, so that she can improve her profits and meet her personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Benita Gregoria

texts.es: La señora Benita Gregoria B. T. cuenta con 64 años de edad, casada Actualmente se dedica al comercio en ventas de productos para el hogar lleva 10 años dedicándose a esta actividad conjuntamente con sus cuatro hijos  reside en el paraje las Clavellinas del cantón Juchanep, municipio y departamento  de Totonicapán, Guatemala, pero en las condiciones a las que vive  son muy complicadas por lo que solicito  un préstamo  acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, y así poder mejorar los productos en ventas como también poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y así poder generar mejores ingresos para poder darles a sus hijos una mejor educación  a sus hijos como también mejorar las condiciones de vidas en las que viven. Mejorando sus ingresos y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Benita Gregoria B. T. is a 64-year-old married woman who has been selling housewares for 10 years with the help of her four children. She lives in Paraje Las Clavellinas in the Juchanep canton, municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. However, her living conditions are difficult, which is why she is turning to Asociación ASDIR for a loan so that she can improve her merchandise and cover customer demand. This way, she can generate more profits and give her children a better education, as well as improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal “Alto Lima” se encuentra L. Asociación Comunal “3 D. mayo”, cuenta con 15 integrantes, L. mayoría se dedica al tejido D. mantas, chompas, manoplas, otras se dedican a L. venta D. frutas, verduras y refrescos. Las que se dedican al tejido necesitan el préstamo para L. compra D. materia prima como L. lana y las que comercializan productos para comprar mercadería.

Una D. las integrantes del grupo es Silveria M. que se dedica al tejido D. mantas, elL. indica que en esta época tiene mayor pedido por el frío y requiere el préstamo para L. compra D. lana.
texts.en:
The 3rd of May community association can be found in Alto Lima, and it has 15 members. The majority dedicate themselves to knitting blankets, sweaters, and mittens. Others sell fruit, vegetables and refreshments. The ones that knit need a loan to buy raw materials such as yarn. Those who are merchants need funds to buy products. One of the members is Silveria M., who dedicates herself to knitting blankets. She indicates that she has the most orders for her goods during this season because of the cold weather, and she needs the loan to buy yarn.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and merchandise.

loans.name: Luz Haydee

texts.es:
La señora Luz Haydee R. D. León    tiene 59 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Laredo , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to secundaria , tiene 3 hijos pero ninguno dependen económicamente D. ella.
Luz Haydee  se dedica a la confección D. ropa para dama, caballeros y niños .
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles compro mas telas, hilos, lentejuelas, algodón, blondas, hilos D. bordar, etc.
Con el crédito D. 1,000 soles lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra D. mas telas ya que también esta confeccionando disfraces y uniformes para profesoras.
Luz Haydee tiene como sueño crear una microempresa D. costura y captar mayor clientela D. diferentes instituciones como colegios, bancos, y instituciones en general.
texts.en:
Luz Haydee R. D. León is 59 years old, and lives in the Laredo district, Trujillo province, in La Libertad, Perú. This entrepreneur studied until the 5th year of secondary school, and has 3 children who no longer depend on her financially. Luz Haydee dedicates herself to making clothing for women, men and children. With her first loan of 300 soles she bought more fabric, thread, sequins, cotton, silk lace, embroidery thread, etc. With the loan of 1,000 soles, she will invest in her business and buy more fabric since she is also making costumes and uniforms for teachers. Luz Haydee’s dream is to create a sewing enterprise and attract more customers from different institutions such as schools and banks. 

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel P. tiene 46 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Laredo , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta sexto D. primaria , tiene 3hijos, pero 2 dependen económicamente D. ella.
Maria Isabel se dedica a la realización a la venta D. productos D. belleza D. Esika, Avon, Unique. Los cuales los distribuye en distintos puestos del  mercado D.  Laredo, pero también venD. a sus amistades, vecinos y familiares.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles compro mas productos para que pueda vender con mas frecuencia.
Con el crédito D. 2,000 soles lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra D. mas productos D. belleza D. esika , avon, unique como: colonias , talcos, cremas, perfumes, labiales, etc
Maria Isabel   tiene como sueño alquilar un stand en un centro comercial D. Trujillo  y vender sus productos
texts.en:
Maria Isabel P. is 46 years old, and lives in the Laredo district, Trujillo province, in La Libertad, Perú. This entrepreneur studied until the 6th year of secondary school, and has 3 children but only 2 still depend on her financially. Maria Isabel dedicates herself to selling beauty products from the Esika, Avon and Unique lines. She distributes these throughout the various markets in Laredo, and also sells to her friends, neighbors, and relatives. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought more products so she could sell more frequently. With the loan of 2,000 soles, she will invest in her business and buy more Esika, Avon and Unique products such as: colognes, powders, creams, perfumes, lipsticks, etc. Maria Isabel’s dream is to rent a stand in a commercial area in Trujillo and sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business, buying beauty products from the Esika, Avon and Unique lines such as:  colognes, powders, creams, perfumes, lipsticks, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Salome

texts.es:
La señora Vilma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Poderosas de Santa Rosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 49 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 09 hijos (todos dependientes de ella)  y tiene estudios  de secundaria incompleta,  vive en el Barrio Panca Quia.

Inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi medio año, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor para engorde

Ahora ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de carneros para engorde y luego los venderá en los días de ferias de la zona.  Los días domingos se dedica a la venta de Pan.

Su deseo es formar un establo de ganado menor y mayor mejorado.

A ella le gusta la garantía solidaria, y su forma de trabajo.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the Las Poderosas de Santa Rosa Community Bank, which is located in the Azangaro district, Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 49, married, and has nine dependent children. She went to high school, but did not finish. She lives in the Panca Quia neighborhood. She started working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos about half of a year ago. She used her initial loan of 300 PEN to buy small life stock to fatten. She now needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy sheep to fatten. She will then sell them on the days the fair is held in her zone. On Sundays she sells bread. Her wish is to set up a large, improved stable for small and large live stock. She likes the warranty of solidarity and the way they work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to fatten

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La señora Elisa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Poderosas de Santa Rosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (4to grado),  vive en el Barrio Revolución.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en la elaboración de alimentos (desayunos al paso). 

Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00, comprará frutas, quinua, leche, cañihua, etc. 
para la preparación de desayunos al paso, esta actividad la realiza por las mañanas.

A ella le gustaría poner un negocio de compra y venta de ropa.

Manifiesta que le gustan  las charlas y los ahorros que ha podido generar.
texts.en:
Elisa belongs to the Community Bank "Las Poderosas de Santa Rosa", located in the district and province of Azangaro in Puno. She is 28 years old, she is married common-law, and she is mother of 2 children. She did not finish high school (grade 10). She lives in the region of Barrio Revolucion.

She has been with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for 1 year. Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 neuvos soles, funds that were invested in preparing foods (fast food breakfast).

This loan of S/.300 will be used to purchase fruit, quinoa grains, milk, and canihua grains etc. to prepare breakfast foods, a daily morning routine.

She would like to set up a business buying and seling clothing.

She says that she loves chatting, and the saving she has managed to put away.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit, quinoa grains, milk, and canihua grains etc.

loans.name: Placida Erudita

texts.es:
La señora Placida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Poderosas D. Santa Rosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Azangaro, Provincia D. Azangaro, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 48 años D. edad, estado civil casada, es madre D. 04 hijos y no tiene estudios,  vive en el Barrio Vilcapaza.
Inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el cual compró ropa. 

Su deseo es ampliar su negocio y poder generar más ganancias. A ella le gustan los ahorros, y las facilidades D. pago.
texts.en:
Placida is a member of the Community Bank "Las Poderosas D. Santa Rosa", located in the district and province of Azangaro in Puno. She is 48 years old, she is married, and is mother to 4 children. She never went to school. She lives in the region of Vilcapaza.

She started out her business with the help of Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner). Her first loan of S/.500 she purchase clothing.

Her wish is to expand her business and to generate a greater income. She loves to be able to save money, and can easily make her payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Rosario Melina

texts.es:
La señora ROSARIO MELINA tiene  51 años D. edad vive en el distrito D. Laredo , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú
La empresaria tiene 31 años D. edad y 2 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente D. ella.
Rosario se dedica a la venda D.  productos D. belleza y cosméticos como: talcos, colonias. Perfumes. Joyas, cremas.,etc D. Avon, Esika y Unique
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles compró productos D. belleza lo cual le permitió aumentar su stock y vender con mayor facilidad
Con el crédito D. 2,000, lo invertirá en la compra D. mas productos  D. Unique, Avon y Esika
Rosa tiene como sueño ampliar su domicilio para poder colocar mas vitrinas y poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosaio Melina is 51 years old and lives in the district of Laredo in the Province of Trujillo in La Libertad, Peru.

She is 31 years old and she has 2 children who are still financially dependent on her.

Rosario owns a beauty product business selling items such as: powders, colognes, perfumes, jewlery, skin creams etc, of the Avon, Esika and Unqiue brand names.

Her first loan of 300 soles was invested in the purchase of beauty products that increase her stock and permitted her to make her sales easier.

This loan of 2000 will be invested inthe purchase of more products of the Unique, Avon and Esika brand names.

Rosa's dream is to renovate her home to be able to place more display cases, and therefore improve her sales.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products of the Unique, Avon, and Esika brand names.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La señora Bernardina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Poderosas D. Santa Rosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Azangaro, Provincia D. Azangaro, Departamento D.
