Eldith will use this loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles to invest in more goods for her business.

Eldith is married but separated and has three adult children. Two of her sons still live at home but have their own jobs and no longer depend on their mother. Eldith very much enjoys working. Loans from Manuela Ramos have helped her to advance her business, which dropped off during a recent period when Eldith was ill, but has since been recovering well.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 47 years old, married with 2 children and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been selling provisions and drinks for the past 3 years. Elizabeth is requesting the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Freda Awuor

texts.en:
Freda O. is a 37-year-old married mother of one. She also has three other dependents: her sister's children, for whom she has been caring since her sister died of breast cancer about two years ago. She currently runs a clothing boutique that has been in operation for 1 year and 8 months. This will be her first business loan from KADET or any other source.

With the 60,000 KES loan, Freda plans to buy children's and women's wear from Kampala, Uganda. This will enable her to better satisfy the needs of her customers, many of whom place special orders through her. As a supplement to her income, Freda also tenders in fabric design for various companies.

Freda hopes to become a wholesaler in the future and would like to move her business to Mombasa's central business district, where she can attend to diverse customer needs.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy children's and women's wear from Kampala, Uganda

loans.name: Nimia

texts.en:
Nimia G. F. is a member of the communal bank “Cesar Vallejo” and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  She has a small business selling candies, cold drinks and popsicles from her home.  She also does a bit of sewing work on the side.  

Nimia has been working with Manuela Ramos for 11 years and was a founding member of her communal bank.  She is widowed and has six adult children.  Although Nimia could stop working at this point, she has worked her whole life and feels she would become bored if she stopped.  Nimia plans to use this loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles to purchase more candies and to invest in used clothing for sale.  Nimia has seen that as people are purchasing more used clothing than hand-sewn goods, she is better off investing in this area than in purchasing more materials for sewing work.  

Nimia feels that she has been helped by Manuela Ramos and has used her loans over the years to purchase many things.  It is very important to Nimia to make her loan payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase candies and used clothing for sale

loans.name: Piotr

texts.en:
Mr. G. buys goods from the wholesale market in Falesti.  Commercial surplus is in addition of 30 - 40%, depending on the type of merchandise sold. He sells flour, sugar, cereals, oil and pasta.
For the preservation of goods, the customer has a deposit. Mr. G. decided to buy a minibus for transporting goods, in order to minimize transportation costs. Advantages to the proposed business and lending are: application to permanent food; business is managed by the owner. 
The loan is required for procuring minibus to transport goods.

Microinvest issues him a loan and wishes him success.

loans.use: To procure minibus to transport goods

loans.name: Lisialan

texts.en:
Lisialan V. D. Z. is a member of the communal bank “Cesar Vallejo” and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  Lisialan is a cheerful, welcoming and outgoing woman.  She sells cooked food from her home during lunchtime and in the evenings. She also sells colorful knitted clothes, bags and decorative pieces.  

Lisialan has been working with Manuela Ramos since 1998.  She will invest this loan of 1500 Nuevos Soles in knitting materials and in food for her home-based restaurant.  Lisialan chose a lower amount for this current loan because she wants to be sure that she can make her loan payments on time.    

Lisialan is 53 and is a single parent to her 19-year-old son.  She is trying to deciD. what to do next in life.  Things have gone well for Lisialan in her involvement with Manuela Ramos.  Through her loans and the growth of her business ventures, Lisialan has been able to expand her house and fix up the few rooms that she rents out to tenants.

loans.use: To purchase knitting materials and food for her restaurant

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora y preocupada por su desarrollo, vive en la casa que le cedieron sus padres y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Cuando instaló su propio consultorio dental, hace 5 años, tenía mucha fe en que le iría bien, por eso decidió trabajar duro y sin descanso para alcanzar sus metas, ella mantiene su consultorio siempre muy limpio y brinda una atención muy cordial a sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes y saber que de esa manera ayuda a las personas a tener una mejor salud. Lleva 15 años ejerciendo esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es realizar las largas jornadas laborales, puesto que por lo general su consultorio está repleto de personas. Adelaida espera que su negocio crezca, para poder atender a más clientes, ella es conciente de que el camino a sus metas es largo y sacrificado, pero está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de lograrlo. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, promete ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a sus compañeras de su banco comunal donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más implementos dentales para renovar y cambiar los que actualmente usa.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 38-years old and is a very hard working woman who is very focused on her development. She lives in a house that was willed to her by her parents and she’s very eager to move forward with her life. It’s been 5-years since she started her dental practice; she had little faith that it would do well, but she worked hard and without rest she set out to achieve these goals. She maintains her practice always keeping it clean and ensures the highest level of courtesy for her clients. She very much enjoys her work as she attends to her clients and knows what are the best ways to help people to achieve better health.

It took 15-years to learn these skills and she believes the biggest challenge is working these long hours as the office is generally filled with people. Adelaida desires to grow the business to be able to attend to more clients. She is aware of the path to her goals is long and requires sacrifice, but she is determined to work hard to achieve them.

This is the 5th loan request with MFP and she promises to be punctual with her debt as she does not want to jeopardize things for her community bank members whom she cares for and respects. With this 1,500 soles Adelaida will purchase more dental equipment to repair and change the ones she currently uses.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dental equipment

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos es una persona muy tranquila y responsable, tiene 45 años y vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres, junto a su esposa Carmen de 45 años, a quien desea dar una mejor vida. Con muchos ánimos de progresar Carlos comienza sus días en su puesto de venta de bicicletas que está ubicado en la Explanada Laguna temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), él es un vendedor muy hábil y siempre convence a sus clientes de comprarle una bicicleta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para encargarse de su negocio y ser su propio jefe. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer todo el día bajo el inclemente sol, ya que esto lo cansa mucho. Para un futuro cercano, Carlos espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender bicicletas nuevas, ya que actualmente se dedica a vender las bicicletas que arregla. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y espera tener la misma puntualidad que tuvo en sus dos primeros créditos. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y solidario. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más bicicletas para arreglarlas y así incrementar la cantidad que vende.
texts.en:
Carlos is an easy-going and responsible person. His is forty-five years old and lives in a house that he inherited from his parents. He lives with is wife Carmen, 45 years old, to whom he desires to provide a better life. With a lot of drive to succeed, Carlos begins his days at his business selling bicycles at the “Esplanada Laguna”. It is a temporary location in the city of Juliaca where they have fairs. He is a very able salesperson. He always convinces his customers to buy bicycles. What he likes the best about his business is the freedom to be own boss. He has been in business for five years. He finds that the most difficult part of his business is to remain all day in the sun as it tires you out a lot. In the near future, Carlos hopes to have a store where he can sell new bicycles or bicycles that he fixes up. This is his fifth loan with MFP and he hopes to have the same punctuality that he had with the first two loans. He is a responsible and joint member of the communal bank. With the 600 soles he has requested, he will buy more bicycles to fix up and increase the number that he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his inventory

loans.name: Frida

texts.es: Frida de 40 años es una madre muy amorosa y tierna con sus 4 hijos: Alex de 18, Yovana de 16, Claudia de 14 y Libertad de 2 años. Vive en su propia casa con ellos y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. A lo largo de su vida ha trabajado en varios oficios, pero con el tiempo se dio cuenta que la actividad que tenía como un pasatiempo le podía dar los ingresos económicos que necesitaba. Fue así que decidió dedicarse a los tejidos artesanales, negocio que le está siendo muy rentable debido a que la mayoría de sus clientes la prefieren por los novedosos modelos que tiene. Frida lleva 4 años en esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que al mismo tiempo que cuida su negocio puede realizar sus tareas domesticas, ahorrándole tiempo para hacer otras actividades, pero lo que más le disgusta es que a veces tiene que levantarse en la madrugada para terminar con los pedidos que le solicitan. Para un futuro cercano espera tener su propio puesto donde venda sus tejidos ella misma, ya que actualmente sólo los distribuye a los comerciantes. Este es el quinto préstamo de Frida con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a sus compañeras de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para producir mas tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Frida, 40, is a very loving and tender mother. She has four children; Alex is 18, Yovana is 16, Claudia is 14, and Libertad is 2. She lives with them in her own house. Her biggest wish is to improve their quality of life. During her life she has done different work. With time, she realized that her hobby could give her the income she needed. That is how she decided to make a business from her woven handicrafts. The business is very profitable; most of her customers prefer her weaving because of the original work she does. Frida has been doing this for four years. What she likes the best about her work is that she can take care of her business and her domestic chores at the same time. This saves time to do other things. What she likes the least is that at time she needs to get up at dawn to finish the orders she receives. In the near future she hopes to have her own stand where she can sell her own crafts. She currently only distributes them to merchants. This is Frida’s fifth loan with MFP, and she expects to repay it on time. She does not want to cause problems for her colleagues in her community bank. She is very respected in her community bank for the order that she gives to the group. She will use the 1,500 PEN that she is asking for she will buy more wool to make more woven crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 54 años, es una mujer muy alegre y sencilla, vive en la casa de unos familiares junto a sus 2 hijos; Osías de 19 y Álvaro de 17 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Desde muy niña le gustó trabajar, actualmente tiene un puesto donde vende golosinas y muñecos de peluche, el cual es muy concurrido por sus clientes ya que ella es una vendedora muy alegre y divertida. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta. Para un futuro cercano, Genoveva espera tener una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le genere mejores ingresos económicos, sabe que el camino a sus metas es largo y sacrificado, pero esta dispuesta a recorrerlo. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y espera poderlo pagar a tiempo, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a sus demás compañeras de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más productos y así implementar mejor su puesto de golosinas y muñecos.
texts.en:
Genoveva, 54, is a very happy and unassuming woman. She lives with her two children; Osías who is 19, and Álvaro who is 17, in a house that belongs to relatives. Her children are the motivation for her efforts. She has liked to work since she was a little girl. She currently has a stand where she sells candy and stuffed animals. Her stand has lots of customers because she is a happy and fun sales lady. What she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers. She has been in this business for ten years. The hardest part is having to stay in her stall all day. In the near future Genoveva hopes to have a grocery store. That would generate greater income. She knows that the road to reaching her goals is long and requires sacrifice. But, she is prepared to go down that road. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She expects to be able to pay it back on time. She does not want to cause problems for the other members of her community bank. In the bank she is well liked and respected. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy more products. That way she can improve her candy and stuffed animal stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old and she is divorced with four children. All her children are currently in school. Mary is going through thick and thin, struggling to take care of her family. She is supportive, determined and above all very hardworking. 

She is a petty trader who trades in bags of maize. Her kids are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home. Selling maize has enabled her to rent accommodations for her family. She wants to use the loan to buys more bags of maize to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk.

loans.name: Julieth

texts.es: Julieth tiene 20 años, es una joven muy trabajadora que vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes siempre la apoyaron para salir adelante. Aunque aún es muy joven siente que tiene la responsabilidad de ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, actualmente el negocio al que se dedica es el servicio de cabinas de internet, el cual pudo instalar gracias a la ayuda de sus padres. Estas cabinas las atiende ella misma y se encarga de administrarla, además su negocio tiene muy buena ubicación, ya que no hay muchos por la zona en la que vive. Lo que más le gusta a Julieth de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, pero le es muy difícil atender ella sola a todos las personas que concurren a sus cabinas de Internet. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y espera que en el futuro pueda incrementar la cantidad de computadoras que tiene, sabe que para alcanzar sus metas tiene que trabajar mucho y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Julieth con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos espera poder pagar a tiempo sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está pendiente de los acuerdos a los que se llegan en las reuniones de su grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados hará arreglar una de sus computadoras, ya que por el uso continuo sufrió unos desperfectos. Con el resto del dinero comprará más sillas de plástico para su negocio.
texts.en:
Julieth, 20, is a very hard working young woman. She lives with her parents; they have always helped her to get ahead. Even though she is very young, she feels that she has the responsibility to help her parents with the household expenses. She now has an Internet café, which she was able to install thanks to her parents’ help. She runs and administers the business herself. Her business is in a very good location because there are not many like it in her zone. What Julieth likes best about her work is taking care of her customers. The hardest part is that she must, by herself, take care of everyone who comes to her Internet cafe. She has been doing this for two years. In the future she hopes to be able to increase the number of computers that she has. She knows that she has to work hard to reach her goals. She is prepared to do so. This is Julieth’s fourth loan with MFP. She expects to be able to make her payments on time, the same as she did with her previous loans. She is very happy in her Community Bank. She is always up to date with the agreements made in the group meetings. She will use the 2,000 PEN that she is asking for to fix one of her computers. Continual usage has caused some problems. With the rest of the money she will buy plastic chairs for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer repair

loans.name: Mma

texts.en:
Mma is 48 years old and she is married with four children. Three are in school and one is working. She is living with her husband in a family house at Sefwi in the Western region of Ghana. She is supportive, determined and above all very hardworking. 

She is a petty trader who trades in cereals like bags of maize, beans, millet, groundnuts etc. She takes delivery of her stock from Tamale in the northern region of Ghana.

Her kids are very proud of her because of the enormous contribution she makes in the home. Selling of foodstuffs has enabled her to rent a store in the market place where she sells to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize, millet, beans and groundnuts to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her children’s education. She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy products in bulk

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena tiene 36, es una mujer muy sencilla y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos: Roger 10 y Samaith de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Desde muy niña le gustó trabajar, actualmente tiene un puesto de mercería en el mercado Santa Bárbara (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), en el cual vende botones, cremalleras y otro artículos similares. Magdalena es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre recibe con una sonrisa a las personas que concurren a su negocio y refiere que lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su negocio, aun así sabe que tiene que hacerlo, puesto que el camino a sus metas no es sencillo. Espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el séptimo préstamo de Magdalena con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a sus demás compañeras de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados planea implementar mejor su puesto y ofrecerle una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 36, is a very unassuming and responsible woman. She lives in her own house with her two children; Roger is 10, and Samaith is 2. Her children are the motivation for all of her efforts. She has liked to work since she was a little girl. She currently has a notions stand in the Santa Bárbara market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). She sells buttons, zippers, and similar items. Magdalena is a cheerful sales lady, and she always greets her customers with a smile. What she likes most about her work is chatting with her customers. She has had this business for ten years. The hardest part for her is having to stay in her stand all day. Even so, she knows she has to do it because the road to her goals is not easy. In the future she hopes to expand her business and get improved earnings. This is Magdalena’s seventh loan with MFP. She expects to be able to pay it on time. She does not want to cause problems with the other members of her Community Bank, where she is well liked and respected. She will use the 1,000 PEN she is asking for to improve her stand and offer her customers a greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Povi Inès

texts.fr:
A. Povi Ines est mariée et mère de trois enfants.  Deux de ses enfants sont scolarisés.  Son troisième enfant ira à l’école quand il sera plus âgé.  Son mari a récemment perdu son travail mais il cherche quelque chose d'autre.  Inès habite avec sa famille à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin.  

À Cotonou, Inès vend des produits diverses y compris charbon de bois, sachets de l’eau, et cartes de recharge.  Inès possède une machine qu’emballe de l’eau dans les sachets.  Elle a déjà profité de trois crédits d’ALIDé.  Peu à peu, ces prêts l'ont aidé à augmenter son travail.  Actuellement, Inès vend chez elle.  Les gens du quartier y achètent sa marchandise.   Elle voudrait avoir un prêt d’ALIDé afin d’acheter plus des articles qu’elle vend.  Pour développer son activité dans le future, Inès aimerait vendre en gros des cartes de recharges.
texts.en:
A. Povi Inès is married and the mother of three children. Two of them are in school. Her third child will go to school when he is older. Her husband recently lost his job, but he is looking for something else. She lives with her family in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. In Cotonou, Inès sells various goods, including charcoal, baggies of water, and recharge cards. She has a machine for packaging water in baggies. She has already taken advantage of three ALIDé loans. Little by little, these loans helped her to augment her work. Currently, she sells out of her house. The people in the area go there to buy her merchandise. She would like to obtain an ALIDé loan in order to buy more of the merchandise she sells. To develop her business in the future, she would like to sell recharge cards wholesale.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal, recharge cards, and baggies of water

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is 60 years old, married and has five children. Three are in school and two are independent. She trades in maize in the local market of Sefwi, a town in the western region of Ghana. Her major difficulty is with funds to support the business. She requests a loan to enable her to buy maize in bulk to grow her business and scale up sales. With her 21 years experience in trade, she hopes to increase her savings to support the children’s education and give them a better future and more career opportunities.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.fr:
Résidente à baguida qui est une petite ville non loin de Lomé, cette femme a entamé en 2008 le commerce des habits, elle a appris la couture ce qui lui permet de confectionner des habits pour les revendre, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente des ustensiles de cusine, vu la manière dont ce commerce est rentable, elle voudrait l’agrandir et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 37 pièces de tissus, 17 habits pour dame, 10 boubous pour homme et quelques ustensiles de cuisine.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
A resident of Baguida, a small city not far from Lomé, this woman started working in the clothing business in 2008. She learned how to sew, enabling her to make and sell clothing. She has included with this business the sale of kitchen utensils. Given how profitable the business is, she would like to expand and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 37 bolts of cloth, 17 outfits for women, 10 boubous (long, flowing garments) for men, and some kitchen utensils. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and outfits

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 43 es una vecina muy querida en su barrio, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida. Todos los días camina por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, junto a su inseparable bolso de cosméticos busca clientes que desean comprar alguno de sus productos, ella es muy alegre y siempre atiende a las personas con una sonrisa en los labios. Lo que más le gusta a Maria de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre qué producto le dará mejores resultados, pero lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día bajo el inclemente sol visitando a sus clientes de casa en casa, lo que le causa mucho cansancio. María lleva 5 años en esta actividad y espera hacer crecer su negocio y poder tener una tienda de cosméticos, para así poder mejorar sus ingresos y poco a poco acercarse más a sus metas. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus primeros pagos y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy responsable. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en la compra de más productos de belleza para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Maria, 43, is much loved in her neighborhood. She lives in the house that she inherited from her parents. She has a great desire to get ahead in life. Every day she walks the streets of the city of Juliaca, together with her inseparable cosmetics bag, looking for customers who want to buy some of her products. She is very happy, and she always waits on people with a smile on her lips. What Maria likes most about her work is advising her customers about which product will give them the best results. The most difficult is having to walk all day under the cruel sun while she goes door to door visiting her customers. This makes her very tired. María has been doing this for five years. She hopes to expand her business and be able to have a cosmetics store in order to improve her earnings. Little by little she gets closer to her goals. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her first payments, and she expects to do the same now, too. In her Community Bank she is well liked by the rest of her colleagues because she is very responsible. She will use the 1,000 PEN to buy more beauty products to be able to offer her customers greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 27 years old, single and has no children. She works very hard and saves for the future. Anastasia enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her future kids.

She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. However, she is constrained by low capital to make meaningful progress.

She is requesting the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to make increased profits. She believes with her good customer relations, the loan will enable her to materialize her dream.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc.

loans.name: Marizol

texts.es: Marizol tiene 30 años, es una madre muy querida por su familia, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres junto a su esposo Juan de 32 y sus 4 hijos: Jhon de 11, Daniel de 9, Karen de 7 y Ruth de 5 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes de comprarle algo. Marizol refiere que lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y más aún si las personas que compran son sus “caseros” (clientes regulares). Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es transportar la ropa desde la ciudad de Tacna (al sur del país), ya que le resulta muy cansado el trayecto. Marizol anhela tener una tienda grande de ropa donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus prendas y sabe que tiene que esforzarse mucho para poder salir adelante. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y espera pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no meter en problemas a sus demás compañeras de su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy activa. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Marizol is 30 years old. She is a mother who is very much loved by her family. She lives in the house inherited from her parents. Her husband is Juan, who is 32 years old, and they have four children: Jhon-11, Daniel-9, Karen-7, and Ruth-5. They wish to give them a good life.

Marizol sells clothing from her shop located in the San José market (the largest market in the city of Juliaca). She is a very persuasive saleswoman who always convinces customers to buy something. Marizol says what she likes most about her job is making sales and even more that the people who buy from her are “like family” (her regular customers). She has been in business 10 years, and what she likes least is hauling clothing from the city of Tacna (in the southern part of the country) since it is a very tiring journey.

Marizol longs to have a large clothing store where she can sell her clothes more comfortably. She knows she has to work hard to succeed. This is her fifth loan with MFP and expects to make her payments on time since she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank group, where she is a very active member. With her loan of 1500 soles, she will purchase more clothing to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Comlan

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et père de 02 enfants, il vit dans le quartier d’adamavo, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des produits  congelés, il a commencé ce commerce l’année dernière, le congélateur qu’il utilise pour refroidir ses produits est en panne ce qui a considérablement ralenti son activité et réduit son chiffre d’affaire,il sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour acheter un nouveau congélateur.
texts.en:
Comlan A. is married and the father of two children. He lives in the Adamavo neighborhood of Lomé, Togo. His principal revenue-generating activity is the sale of frozen foods. He started this business last year. However, the freezer that he uses to freeze his products is broken, which has considerably slowed down his activity and reduced his sales. Consequently, he is seeking a credit from WAGES to buy a new freezer.

Translated from French by Andrew Whiteman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 48-year-old local restaurant operator and currently lives with her family. She is married and has seven children. Two of her children are in school, while the rest are learning trades. She has been in food provision for over six years now. She understands customer ethics and is also aware that customers mean cash; for that reason, she does not down play on quality and excellent service.

She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals, she has attracted lots of customers in the area where she serves; therefore, it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in the food delivery service.

She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery de 47 años es una madre de familia muy amorosa y dedicada, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hernán de 50 años y sus 3 hijos: Julio de 21, Roxana de 17 y Hugo de 11 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Su tienda de manualidades es un negocio muy rentable, ya que son varios los clientes que concurren a su establecimiento para comprar adornos u otros artículos, ella trabaja desde muy temprano y se queda prácticamente durante todo el día dentro de su negocio, puesto que sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus metas. Lo que más le gusta a Nery de su trabajo es que puede realizar las tareas de su hogar al mismo tiempo que atiende su negocio. Lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir a la calle. Para más adelante, Nery desea mejorar la infraestructura de su tienda para poder brindarles a sus clientes la atención que ellos se merecen. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una de las socias más activas. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará materiales nuevos para fabricar más manualidades para la venta y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Nery is 47 years old and a mother of a very dedicated and lovely family. She lives in her own house with her 50-year-old husband Hernán and their 3 children: Julio is 21, Roxana is 17, and Hugo is 11. Her children are the motivation for all of her efforts. Her handicraft shop is a very profitable business, since she has several customers who come to her establishment to buy decorations and other items. She starts working very early in the morning and stays in her shop practically all day, since she knows that she has to work very hard to achieve her goals. What Nery likes best about her job is that she can do household tasks at the same time that she is working at her shop. She has been working this way for 12 years and what she likes the least about it is having to stay inside her shop all day without being able to go out into the street. For the future, Nery wants to improve the infrastructure of her shop so that she can provide her customers the service that they deserve. This is her third loan with MFP and she feels the responsibility to pay her dues on time, since she desires access to more loans in the future. In her village bank she is one of the most active partners. With the 2000 nuevos soles that she is asking for she will buy new materials to build more handicrafts to sell and therefore improve her economic gains.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is 48 years old, single and mother of three children; two are in school and one is learning a trade. She prepares and serves wheat porridge in the morning, and she sells that through hawking. Ama switches over in the afternoon with the sale of rice with stew. Her food is very tasty and affordable and, because of that, many buy from her stand. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi, which is a nearby city. She is requesting a loan to buy wheat, rice, vegetables etc. to meet the daily demand of her customers. With her four years experience, she hopes to utilize the loan to make good income for taking care of the children.

loans.use: To buy cereals like wheat, rice, sugar, vegetables, meat etc.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: Ysabel tiene 37 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en la casa de unos familiares junto a su esposo Félix de 42 años y sus 3 hijos: Maribel de 12, Luis de 10 y Edwar de 6 años y lo que más desea es brindarle una vida digna a su familia. Tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de artesanías en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), la cual es muy concurrida por sus clientes debido a que ella es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática que siempre les brinda una atención muy cordial. A Ysabel le gusta conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en el mercado, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar otras actividades. Para el futuro, Isabel espera que su negocio crezca y que pueda incrementar la cantidad de artesanías que produce, para poder mejorar sus ingresos. Sabe que el camino hasta sus metas es muy largo y sacrificado, pero Ysabel está dispuesta a afrontarlo, con la única finalidad de darles una mejor vida a sus hijos. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y al igual como hizo en sus primeros crédito desea pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que sabe que sino lo hace meterá en problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por lo responsable que es. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará materiales nuevos para fabricar más tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 37 years old and is the mother of a lovely family. She lives in of one of her relative's house with her 42-year-old husband Félix and their three children: Maribel is 12, Luis is 10, and Edwar is 6. What she desires most is to provide a worthy life for her family. She has a small craft stand at the Explanada Laguna Temporal (a place where there are markets in the city of Juliaca). Her stand is very crowded with her customers due to the fact that she is a very happy and charismatic vendor and always provides them will very cordial attention. Ysabel likes to talk to her customers and find out about what is happening in the market. She has been working this way for 10 years and what she likes least about her job is having to stay inside her store all day, without being able to go out on the street to carry out other activities. For the future, Ysabel hopes that her business grows and that she can increase the quantity of crafts that she makes in order to improve her income. She knows that the road to her goals is very long and requires sacrifice, but Ysabel is determined to confront it with her only goal being to give her children a better life. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and like she did with her previous loans, she desires to pay her fees on time since she knows that if she does not it will give her problems with her village bank, where she is very respected for how responsible she is. With the 1500 nuevos soles requested she will buy new materials to make more hand-woven crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Bersy

texts.es: Bersy tiene 36 años, es una mujer que ha sabido progresar sola en la vida, vive de manera independiente en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. En el distrito de Nuñoa (distrito de la provincia de Melgar del departamento de Puno) Bersy tiene su tienda de abarrotes, ella se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable, lleva realizando esta actividad 20 años y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio. Por otro lado considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar otras actividades. Para un futuro cercano espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y ofrecerles una mayor variedad de productos, para ello sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro y sin descanso. Este es el noveno préstamo de Bersy con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy responsable y siempre está pendiente de que se cumplan los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los tres mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Bersy is 36 years old and is a woman who has known how to progress on her own in life. She lives independently in the house that she inherited from her parents and what she desires most is to improve her quality of life. In the district of Nuñoa (district of the province of Meglar of the department of Puno), Bersy has her own grocery store. She is very happy with her business since it is very profitable. She has been working in this business for 20 years and what she likes best about it is talking with her customers and finding out what is happening in her neighborhood. On the other hand, what she considers most difficult about her job is having to stay inside her shop all day, without being able to go out on the street to carry out other activities. In the near future she hopes to have a bigger store where she can better attend to her customers and offer them a larger variety of products. For this she knows that she has to work very hard and without rest. This is Bersy’s 9th loan with MFP – she knows that she has to pay it back on time and she is determined to do so. In her village bank she is very responsible and is always waiting for agreements to be fulfilled between partners. With the 3500 nuevos soles requested, she will buy more products to improve her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Cinthia Maria

texts.es: La Señora Cinthia María C. tiene la edad de 44 años. Cinthia esta casada con Juan. Tienen 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es una pulperia. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio con muy pocos prodcutos ya que no ofrecia una gran variedad, pero con el muy poco dinero que recogia de sus ganancias logro aumentar su pulperia, y con la yuda de los financiamientos que fueron de gran ayuda para iniciar este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos basicos,jabones, detergentes y golosinas. El sueño de Cinthia es diversificar en sus productos y convertir su pequeña pulperia en una distribuidoa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cinthia María C. is 44 years old and married to Juan. They have 1 dependent child. She owns a grocery store and has been in business for more than 4 years. When she started, she had few products and did not offer great variety, but with the little money she saved from her earnings was able to open her business.

The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to buy basic grains, soaps, detergents and candy. Cinthia dreams of diversifying her products and converting her small grocery store into a wholesale outlet.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of four children who are in school. Abena is an entrepreneur, dynamic and very dedicated to her work. She works hard to support her husband in taking care of the children. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil for over fifteen years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. She produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals and she even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods elsewhere when demand becomes very high.

Prices of raw materials are very high, making it difficult to achieve her target. It is her dream to achieve her target through loan support. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nut fruits, to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nut fruits

loans.name: La Fe Group 6

texts.en:
Lucia F., a 68 year-old widow from the rural community of Kilometro 7, Dominican Republic, owns her own business selling food items and men's and women's apparel. She is also the group coordinator for the Bank of Hope called La Fe (The Faith) Group 6. Her story is illustrative of the experiences of her fellow borrowers in La Fe Group 6. 

Lucia runs her own business selling food, including homemade bread and fresh pineapple, and men's and women's clothing. Today she is looking to take out her fifth loan from Kiva and Esperanza International. When she receives her new loan, Lucia will make a three-hour journey to the capital city of Santo Domingo in order to buy more merchandise for her store. She will then sell the food and clothing she buys in Santo Domingo to her friends and neighbors in the rural sugarcane-cutting community (called a batey) of Kilometro 7. 

As Lucia's business has grown over time, she has been able to take out bigger and bigger loans, and she reports that her quality of life has improved little by little with each new loan cycle. As a widow with one grown son, Lucia is dependent on revenues from her business for her livelihood and hopes to see her business continue to grow in the future. She is pictured on the far right of the attached photo.

loans.use: To purchase new food and clothing items for small general store

loans.name: Kesse

texts.en:
Kesse is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of one child. They are a very humble family who wants to invest in their future. She lives at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. She is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fishes, tinned tomatoes, bags of rice, etc. Selling these products, she says they move very fast and you can easily recover your money. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi.

With her three years of experience in her business, she wants to add other foodstuffs like maize, eggs and other items which are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this can be possible with the help of loan assistance. Therefore, she wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tinned tomatoes, etc. She is very much convinced that the loan would help her increase her stock in the event of a price hike.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like cooking oil, bags of rice, spices and tinned tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is 27 years old. She is married with one kid who currently attends school. She lives with her family in Sefwi Wiawso, Ghana. Gifty owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. She is a very skillful and talented hairdresser. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service; therefore, she wants to use this loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like hair weave, pomade, shampoo, activators, and the like to serve her customers. She dreams that she can one day send her child to a university.  She would also like to build her own house. Gifty says your support is much needed to realize those long-awaiting dreams.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of hair products like hair weave, pomade, shampoo, activators etc.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.es: Thelma M. Rodríguez tiene la edad de 49 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que sus inicios comienzan por cuenta propia y empezó a salir a vender por las tardes, ya que tenía que encargarse de sus hijos cuando ellos iban a la escuela ella, se ganaba la vida recorriendo las calles para ofrecerles a sus clientes sus productos, además recorre ciertos comarcas aledañas, ya que con muy pocas ganancias logro incrementar su inventario. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para la compra de capital de trabajo y así comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas y ropa interior. El sueño de Thelma es lograr que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Thelma M. Rodríguez is a 49 year old single mother. She is raising three children. She sells clothes. She has been doing this for seven years. She started on her own. She had to take care of her children, and she left in the afternoons to sell. When the children went to school she earned a living by traveling the streets and offering her products to her customers. She also travels to some nearby regions. She was able to increase her inventory even with small earnings. She is now asking for a loan for working capital. She will buy pants, shirts, skirts, and underwear. Thelma’s dream is to be able to finance her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 25 años, es una madre muy amorosa y querida por su familia, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Luis de 26 años y sus 2 hijos; Rosabel de 9 y Kevin de 5 años, quienes son su principal motivación. En Nuñoa (distrito de la provincia de Melgar departamento de Puno), se encuentra la tienda de Elena, la cual por su proximidad a la plaza principal de la ciudad es muy concurrida, ella abre todos los días a las 6 de la mañana y siempre que entra un cliente a su tienda lo recibe con mucha cordialidad y una amplia sonrisa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que al ser la administradora de su negocio, puede decidir qué horas trabajar y qué horas dedicarse a las tareas del hogar. Elena lleva 10 años atendiendo a la gente y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, aun así sabe que tiene que continuar trabajando duro para mejorar su vida. Para un futuro cercano, espera que su tienda crezca y se vuelva la principal de Nuñoa. Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llega el grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Elena is 25. She is a very loving mother who is well loved by her family. She lives in her own house with her husband, Luis, who is 26; and her two children, Rosabel, who is 9; and Kevin, who is 5. Her children are her primary motivation. Her store is in Nuñoa (district in the Melgar province, Puno department), and it is very busy because of its proximity to the main plaza in the city. She opens every day at six in the morning. Every time a customer enters the store she greets them very cordially with a wide smile. What she likes the best about her work is that, as the administrator, she gets to decide what hours she works and what hours she does the housework. She has been waiting on people for ten years. What she considers the most difficult is having to stay in her store all day. Even so, she knows she needs to keep working hard to improve her live. In the near future she hopes that her store grows until it becomes the best in Nuñoa. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments on time, and she is prepared to do so. She is always up to date with the agreements the group comes to in her Community Bank. She will use the 3,000 PEN she is asking for to buy more products to improve her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy alegre y soltera, vive sola en un cuarto alquilado y con el pasar de los años a hecho que su calidad de vida vaya progresando poco a poco. Los 8 años que viene dedicándose a la venta de ropa le han servido para forjarse una vida digna, tiene un pequeño puesto en la plaza principal de Nuñoa, el cual es muy concurrido, sobre todo por las personas que llegan de visita a dicho distrito, es por eso que acaba rápidamente con la ropa que vende. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y darles confianza para que compren alguna prenda, pero lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todo el día bajo el inclemente sol, lo cual la desgasta bastante. Su deseo a futuro es implementar una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le pueda generar ingresos económicos adicionales. Este es el quinto préstamo de Julia con MFP, se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere meter en problemas a sus demás compañeras de banco comunal, donde es muy querida debido a la alegría que le pone a las reuniones. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más ropa y así incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Julia, 40, is a very happy single woman. She lives alone in a rented room. With the passage of the years, she has made the quality of her life improve little by little. The eight years that she has been selling clothes have served for her to build herself a decent life. She has a small stand in the principal plaza of Nuñoa. It is very crowded, primarily with people who come to visit the district. That is why she rapidly runs out of the clothes she sells. What she likes most is chatting with her customers and giving them the confidence to buy an article of clothing. But, the most difficult is having to work all day under the cruel sun. That really wears her out. Her hope for the future is to set up a grocery store, which would generate additional income. This is Julia’s fifth loan with MFP. She feels responsible about paying on time, because she does not want to cause problems for her colleagues in her Community Bank. She is well liked in her Community Bank for the happiness she brings to the meetings. She will use the 2,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy more clothes and increase the amount of merchandise that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 21 years old and is a married mother of two. She lives with her husband and children in Sefwi Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Rita is a very resourceful mother to her children. She sells eggs in the community market where she lives. Rita gets her stock from retailers and resells them boiled or raw. She complains that the retailers sell eggs to her at a high price, which makes it difficult for her to save. She is requesting for this loan to travel to the poultry farmers so that she can buy eggs in bulk. This, Rita believes, would help her save more to provide better support for her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs in bulk.

loans.name: Hermes Francisca

texts.es: El Joven Hermes Pérez O. tiene 27 años, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de comida y refrescos naturales. Por lo que vive de una manera muy humilde, y con  mucho sacrificio logro establecer este negocio que le ha dado lo necesario, para que salir adelante, con este medio de vida. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio con este negocio por cuenta propia, y que sus propósitos son de proporcionar lo necesario para su familia, ya que alguna veces no tenia las facultades necesarias para proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día. Pero esto no detuvo a Hermes par salir adelante con su negocio. Por lo que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, aceite, frijoles, tomates y cebollas. El sueño de Hermes es que a su familia no le falte la comida ni lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Hermes Pérez O. is a young man who is 27 years old. He sells food and natural beverages. He lives very humbly. With great sacrifice, he was able to start his business which has provided for his needs and allowed him to succeed in this time of his life. He has been in this business for more than 7 years.

Using his own money, he started his business with the intention of providing for his family’s needs. Sometimes he does not earn the necessary resources to provide his family’s daily bread. However, this has not stopped Hermes from succeeding in his business. His requested loan will be used as working capital to purchase basic grains (such as rice), cooking oil, beans, tomatoes and onions. Hermes hopes that his family does not go hungry or lack basic living necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 35 years old.  She is married with seven children, all of whom currently attend school. Her husband is a trader and a farmer in the community where they live. Life, she says, is a bit of a challenge with her family, but she tries hard to help support them. Elizabeth currently sells earrings made with silver, copper, and gold by hawking them at the local market. She gets these goods delivered to her from Kumasi, Ghana. She is requesting for this loan to buy additional earrings and to upgrade her stock. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy assorted earrings in bulk.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 45-year-old married mother of six. Four of her children attend school while the other two work. She is a food vendor and sells rice with gravy stew in her community. She also sells meat pies. Joyce started her operation about ten years ago in order to take care of her home. Her food production is on a low scale because she has inadequate funds to support her business. She wants to use this loan to buy more meat, vegetables, and bags of rice so she can produce her goods in larger quantities and increase her efficiency. Joyce believes this will help expand her business so she can raise more income to support and provide for her family and to finance her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables, meat, bags of rice, and firewood.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita O. is 24 years old. She is married with one kid who is currently breastfeeding. She lives with her family in Sefwi Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. She is a very skillful and talented hair dresser. After three years of experience, she erected a wooden structure where she now provides service to her customers. Rita believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service; therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like hair weave, pomade, shampoo, activators, hair dryer machines, and the like to better serve her customers. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of hair products like hair weave, pomade, shampoo, and activators.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 30 años, la mayor parte de su vida la ha pasado trabajando y tratando de salir adelante. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 32 años, quien siempre la ayuda y acompaña en sus actividades cotidianas. Su tienda escolar está situada en el Colegio Secundario “Tupac Amaru”, la cual es muy visitada por los niños, quienes a la hora del recreo no dudan en usar el dinero que le dieron sus padres en los ricos pasteles que vende Lourdes en su kiosco, ella es muy carismática y alegre por lo cual siempre atiende con mucho cariño a los estudiantes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es distraerse con los niños, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. Para un futuro cercano, Lourdes espera tener una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual pueda incrementar sus ingresos y así tener una vida mejor. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta por la nueva oportunidad, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados incrementará la cantidad de golosinas y pasteles que vende en su tienda escolar.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 30 years old and for most of her life she has been working and trying to get ahead. She lives in her own house with her husband José who is 32 years old. He is always helping her and accompanies her on her everyday activities. Her store is located in the Tupac Amaru Secondary School where it is frequented by the young people during recess, and they never hesitate to use the money which their parents have given them to buy the delicious baked treats that she sells at her stand. Lourdes is very charismatic and cheerful and always treats the students with great affection. What she likes best about her work is to entertain herself with the children. She's been doing this for three years and she thinks that what she likes least is having to remain at her stand all day long without being able to leave. In the near future Lourdes hopes to have a grocery store which would allow her to increase her income and thus have a better life. This is her sixth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she is very satisfied with this new opportunity. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time in order not to do a disservice to the other members of her communal bank where she is very well liked. The 9,000 Sols that she is requesting will be used to increase the inventory of sweets and baked goods that she has in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 31 años, es una mujer muy cariñosa y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jorge de 46 años y sus 4 hijos: Jorge de 10, Rosa de 8, Vanesa de 6 y Marco de 4 años y lo que más desea es darles una buena vida. A dos cuadras de la plaza principal de Nuñoa (distrito de la provincia de Melgar departamento de Puno) se encuentra la tienda de abarrotes de Nelly, la cual es muy concurrida por los vecinos de su barrio, puesto que es una vendedora muy agradable, amable y siempre recibe a su compradores con una sonrisa en los labios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y lo hace con mucha habilidad y paciencia, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Para un futuro cercano, Nelly espera que su negocio crezca y pueda incrementar la cantidad de productos que ofrece para mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, para lo que tendrá que ahorrar poco a poco de sus ganancias. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y solidaria, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus demás compañeras. Con los mil ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para su tienda, así podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Nelly, 31 years old, is a warm and cheerful woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Jorge, 46 years old, and their four children: Jorge, Rosa, Vanesa, and Marco, who are 10, 8, 6, and 4 years old, respectively. Nelly's greatest desire is to give a good life to her children. Two blocks from the main plaza of Nuñoa (district of the province of Melgar and the department of Puno) is Nelly's grocery store. It is very popular with people of her neighborhood because she is a saleswoman very pleasant and kind and always greets her customers with a smile. She enjoys selling very much and has the ability and the patience to do so. She has done this work for seven years and feels that the most difficult part of her work is being confined inside the store all day. In the near future, Nelly hopes that her business grows and that the number of products she offers increases, so she can increase her income. This is her second loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she feels a responsibility to make her payments on time. To make timely payments, she must save a little every day from her earnings. She is a very active and supportive member of her village bank, which has earned her the respect of her peers. With the requested $600, she will buy more products for her store and therefore offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is married and the mother of three children. She is 41years old and currently living with her family. She is a very hard working woman and committed to her work. She prepares and sells doughnuts in her neighborhood. They are prepared from flour; her doughnuts are mostly purchased by the school children and she sometimes sells the rest through hawking. Georgina treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She asks for this loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine etc. to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, sugar, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es una mujer de 31 años, muy sencilla y amable, vive en su casa propia con sus 2 hijos; Roció de 8 y Carlos de 6, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Una de las tiendas más llenas y concurridas de Nuñoa (distrito de la provincia de Melgar del departamento de Puno) es la de Paulina, ella es una vendedora muy alegre y persuasiva, que siempre logra convencer a sus clientes de llevarse algo de su tienda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y hacerles más amena la actividad de comprar, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer durante todo el día dentro de su tienda si poder salir a la calle. Para un futuro cercano espera que su tienda crezca y se vuelva una de las más importantes de Nuñoa. Este es el segundo préstamo de Paulina con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que siente que tiene una responsabilidad con sus compañeras de banco comunal, donde es muy respetada por el orden que le pone a las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar el stock de su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old Paulina is a very unassuming and kind woman. She lives in her own home with her two children: Roció, 8, and Carlos, 6. They are the cause of all her efforts. One of the busiest stores in Nuñoa (district in the province of Melgar and the department of Puno) is Paulina's. She is a very cheerful and persuasive saleswoman who always convinces her customers to take something home. Most of all, she enjoys conversing with her customers and making their visit to her store more enjoyable. After doing this work for ten years, she thinks the most difficult part of her job is remaining all day inside the store. In the near future, she hopes that her store will grow and become one of the most important stores in Nuñoa. This is Paulina's second loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she is willing to make her payments on time. She feels a responsibility toward her peers at the village bank, where she is highly respected for the order she imposes on the meetings. With the requested $350, she will buy more products for her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 29 years old. She is married and the mother of two children who are currently in school. She lives with her children at Sefwi Dwinase in the western region of Ghana. She is a baker and bakes bread for her loyal customers. For the past four years, she is been baking bread and pastries to support her household. In spite of the challenges she faces she manages to handle demands of her customers and successfully meet their requests on time. Her only problem now has to do with finding adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are shooting up. She requests a loan to help her to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and save more for the future eventuality. She said your help is much needed in her life and business.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es: Petronila es una mujer sencilla y muy amable, tiene 56 años y vive en una casa como cuidante junto a su hijo Juan de 28 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. En un pequeño cuarto de adobe, Petronila teje sus artesanías, las cuales luego vende a los mayoristas, quienes se encargan de vender y distribuir las prendas. Sus tejidos llegan a los mercados de ciudades importantes como: Cuzco, Puno, Juliaca, etc., ya que los modelos que realiza son realmente novedosos. En sus 17 años con este negocio, lo más difícil para Petronila es hacer el acabado a sus tejidos, puesto que esto es lo que más demora y debe ser muy paciente; pero sabe que eso no es impedimento para alcanzar sus metas e instalar una tienda de tejidos artesanales, ya que disfruta mucho de tejer y mientras más lo hace mejor se siente. Petronila tiene 4 préstamos con MFP y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta y sabe que cuenta con sus compañeras como apoyo para su progreso. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos y mejores materiales para fabricar tejidos de mayor calidad.
texts.en:
Petronilla is a very amiable and simple woman. She is 56 years old and lives in a home as a caretaker, along with her son Juan who is 28. What she wishes for the most is to improve her quality of life. In a small adobe room, Petronila knits her crafts, which she then sells to wholesalers who are in charge of selling and distributing the garments. Her knitting work arrives at the markets of important cities such as Cuzco, Puno, Juliaca, etc. since the models that she makes are really new. In her 17 years with this business, the most difficult thing for Petronila is to finish her work because this is what takes the most time and she needs to be patient. However, she knows that this is not an impediment to achieve her goals and start a shop of her knitting work. She enjoys knitting a lot and it makes her feel better. Petronila has four loans with MFP and she is very punctual with her repayments since she does not want to cause problems with her community bank, with which she feels very happy. She knows that she can count on her colleagues for support for her progress. She will purchase new and better materials to make better quality garments with the 2,000 Soles she's requested.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for her knitting work.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is divorced and has four children. She lives with her family at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. She is 38 years old. She runs a clothing stand and has sold ladies and children wears like blouses and skirts, lingerie, underwear, slippers and dressing bags for the past ten years. She is constrained by the funds needed to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to be able to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase children and ladies clothing for resale

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is a 40 year old, married woman and mother to three children. Two of the children are in community primary school while the eldest has completed the senior high school. Leticia is a food vendor and sells rice with gravy stew at the community where she lives. She started her business about ten years ago while taking care of her home. Her food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business. She wants to use this loan to buy more meat, vegetables and bags of rice to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business. This will allow her to raise more income to support and provide for her family and finance her children’s education. She desires to sell all that she has in order to send her first-born child to university.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Cleotilde Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Cleotilde O. es madre soltera, tiene 58 años de edad. Su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de costura y la venta de sus prendas de vestir. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios surgen por que sus padres le enseñaron este oficio para salir adelante, y al ver que le gusto decide mantener este negocio por lo que no fue nada difícil ya que tenía que cuidar a su hija y al mismo tiempo entregar a sus clientes sus encargos, su hija le ayuda a vender sus productos en la calle de manera ambulante y los días de semana estudia con la ayuda incondicional de su Mama. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa como camisetas, faldas y pantalones. Su sueño es mantener su negocio, ya que esta es la manera más humilde  para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Doña Cleotilde O. is a single mother and is 58-years-old. She offers a sewing service and sells clothing. She has had this business for more than 7 years. It began because her parents taught her this trade so she could get ahead. When it was clear she liked this work, she decided to maintain her business because it wasn't difficult and she had to support her daugther. As she works on her customers' orders, he daughter helps her by selling her products as a street vendor. On weekdays, her daughter studies with the unconditional support of her mother. The financing she is requesting will go towards working capital to buy clothing like t-shirts, skirts, and pants. Her dream is to maintain her business since this is the most humble way of achieving her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel M. es una persona humilde que atiende un pequeño negocio de venta de comida, su especialidad es la atencion con el Silpancho que es un apanado de carne con papa, ensalada, arroz, y huevo frito, el solamente trabaja con Emprender, ademas el esta ampliando el negocio y proximamente atendera almuerzo, tiene una cocinera y el atiende personalmente su pequeño negocio, el cual esta abierto en horario de medio día y por la noche lo que le da tiempo para estudiar, el quiere ser profesor.
texts.en:
Samuel M. is a humble person who has a small business making and selling food. His specialty is silpancho, which is breaded meat served with potatoes, salad, rice, and a fried egg. He only works with Emprender. He is also expanding his business and will soon serve lunch. He has a cook and he attends to his small business personally. It is open from noon until nighttime, which gives him time to study because he wants to be a teacher.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will invest in the construction of a bathroom for his business and will buy a sink and a toilet.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 26 years old. She is married and mother of one child who is in school. She lives at Sefwi, in the western region of Ghana with her family. She is determined to provide for her child through hard work and commitment. To support her child, she has been selling cosmetics and perfumes with products like spray, powder, lip-gloss, blouses etc. and sells through hawking. She has been in business for four years now. She says selling of cosmetics is very lucrative. Therefore, she wants to use this loan to expand her inventory and enable her make a good income to sponsor her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is 49 years old. She is a widowed mother with five children. Currently two of her children are in school while the others are learning trades. Akua lost her husband after a prolonged sickness. She fought very hard with her working capital to provide life to her husband but she could not. Right now all family responsibility rests on her. She sells bush meat to local restaurant operators so they can prepare their meals. She takes an inventory of meat from the hunters and supplies them to her loyal customers. She has been in business for six years while taking care of the family. She requests the loan so that she can buy more bush meats directly from the farmers so that she can make a profit from it. With the loan she believes she will have resources to care for her children.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of bush meats.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 31 years old. He is married with two children. Currently, one child is in schooling and the other is still breastfeeding. Francis owns and operates a grocery shop where he sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits, etc. in the local market. He wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc. to expand his business. He hopes to make a good income from the expanded business to enable him to provide a quality education for his children. He wants to use the proceeds to build his own house.

loans.use: To buy bulk items for his grocery store.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Amor Y Paz Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Amor y Paz está conformado por Karla Vanesa P. Hernández y Johana del Socorro Bermúdez. Karla tiene 2 hijos que son menores de edad. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de CD y DVD. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que algunas veces sale a vender sus productos de manera ambulante, por lo que así sus clientes conocen de las nuevas películas y así ofrecerle lo mas reciente y nuevo ya que en sus propósitos está el de ofrecerle a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Ella solicita es financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para incrementar en su inventario. El sueño de Karla es realizar la compra de 2 motos taxis, que le permitan generar más ingresos para su familia. Su amiga Johana tiene 3 hijos, y están a su cargo.
