Note: “Mukhtaran baji is showing her sewing machine in this picture”.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ourn

texts.en:
Besides being a farmer in Kompong Cham Province, Ourn L., 31, has just started a business of producing an ordinary kind of food for an income US$4.50 per day. She lives with her husband and her two school-aged children. Her husband is a farmer who always collects cow dunk and bananas to sell for an income of $6 per day.

To make a better living standard, L. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to buy a motorbike for her husband to run a business giving transportation services to the people in his village or at the markets when he is available form his work in the field. L. thinks she will be able to generate more income for her family and make a better living standard with the loan given by Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
S. akossiwa exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de boissons alcoolisées locales appelées « SODABI », elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de cartes de recharges. Elle s’approvisionne en boissons à l’intérieur du pays à KOUVE. Son stock actuel de sodabi a diminué, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 07 bidons de sodabi et des cartes de recharges.
Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
S. Akossiwa earns revenues through commerce in a local alcoholic drink called "SODABI". She has included with this commerce the sale of recharge cards (for mobile phones). She supplies herself from within the country, in KOUVE. Her current stock of sodabi is diminished. Wanting to stock up again, she is requesting a loan to buy seven drums of sodabi and some recharge cards. She is married and the mother of four.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages and recharge cards

loans.name: Korn

texts.en: Korn C., age 41, works as a construction builder with an income of $4 per day in Phnom Penh City. She is married and lives with four children who have all dropped out of school. They help their father who works as a construction foreman with an income of $6 per day. Because Chard wants to have a better standard of living, she is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike in order to enable her to have a business selling shacked-coconut juice. She thinks the expected business, in which she plans to invest both her loan and efforts, will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Elizabeth is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, a sari-sari or general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2000 PHP per month for these activities.

In 1995, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Elizabeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: En 2004, cette jeune femme qui est célibataire a commencé le commerce en détail de produits génériques. C’est avec le revenu de ce commerce qu’elle subvient à ses propres charges. Actuellement elle fait face à une rupture de stock et voudrait se réapprovisionner, elle demande par conséquent à WAGES un crédit pour acheter 165 boîtes de produits génériques
texts.en:
In 2004, this young woman, who is unmarried, started a retail business in generic pharmaceutical products. With the revenues from this business, she provides for herself. Currently, she is facing an inventory shortage and would like to stock up again. She is therefore asking WAGES for a loan to buy 165 containers of pharmaceutical products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Sakina Niaz Ali Group

texts.en:
I am Sakina and I have been a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. I am an uneducated lady because my parents couldn’t afford my education expenses due to having few financial resources. I spend my life by taking care of my family. In my parents’ house I perform my duties as a daughter and a sister very efficiently.

Now my responsibilities have automatically shifted to my husband’s house where I perform my duties as a wife and a mother efficiently. My husband runs a fruit-selling business. He buys fruit wholesale and sells to different fruit shops and also treks to different towns to sell. I am applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits to advance my husband’s business.

I am the group leader of three other women from my locality:

Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell.

Kosar baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Allah rakhi tabasum baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell.

Note: Sakina baji is seated second from the left in this photo.

loans.use: To buy more seasonal fruits for her husband to sell

loans.name: Rukhsana Muhammad Amen Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana Baji is a wife of M. A., and for the past 15 years has been a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a construction supply business, and has been selling supplies to building contractors for over 3 years. Rukhsana Baji is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to advance her husband’s business.

This is a group loan, and Rukhsana Baji is the group leader. The other three members are women from her area. Zubaida Baji wants a loan to buy materials (beads, colored thread and clothes) for preparing embroidered clothes. Rubina Baji wants to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Azharan Baji wants to buy materials (cooking oil, lentils and spices) for her food-selling business. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Rukhsana Baji is seated in a white shawl in this picture.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for resale

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Cette femme a commencé l’année dernière le commerce des produits cosmétiques, son commerce a déjà pris un élan remarquable, compte tenu de cela elle veut agrandir son stock de marchandises pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Elle sollicite a lors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des produits de beauté, des parfums, déodorants, mèches et perruques.
Elle est mariée, et avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce, elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Last year, this woman started doing commerce in cosmetics. Her business has already achieved remarkable momentum. Given this, she wants to expand her stock of merchandise to satisfy her customers better. So she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy beauty products, perfumes, deodorants, hair extensions, and wigs. She is married, and with what she earns from her commerce, she helps to support her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun T., 42, is married and lives in Kampong Cham Province with her six children. Her husband moved to work in Phnom Penh City as a construction worker with an income of US$8 per day. She has made up her mind that she wants to take a loan of US$700 to create a business of selling groceries at her house with the assistance of her children. If she succeeds in her business plan, she will find a job suitable for her husband to work back in his hometown.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her new grocery store

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian G. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, in the province of Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Vivian has recently started a business venture in the agriculture sector, which she owns & operates. While not the only means of generating revenue for this business, the main source of its income is raising pigs for sale.

In 2009, Vivian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Vivian's first loan through GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fishermen and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her agriculture business

location.town: Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Nom

texts.en:
Nom P., 43, makes a very simple living in Kampong Cham Province as a rice cultivator with an income of US$2 per day. She is married and has three children. Her husband raises pigs and can earn around US$5 per day. Her three children are all employed and work as construction workers to help support the living of the family.

Nom P. plans to take a loan of US$1,000 to buy a used car and sell it for a fairly profitable price. By doing this, she hopes she will be able to generate more income.

loans.use: To buy a used car for reselling

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce dans la vente de la friture, beaucoup de gens viennent acheter chez elle surtout les soirs. Les entrants dans la préparation de ses fritures sont épuisés, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 bidon d’huile, 10 cartons de poissons et divers.
 Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, c’est avec le revenu qu’elle contribue aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a woman who sells fried foods. Many people come and buy from her, especially in the evenings. The ingredients for making her product are out of stock. She wants to stock up again and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 10 drums of cooking oil, 10 boxes of fish, and various other items. She is married and the mother of four. With the revenues, she helps to support her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, fish, and various items

loans.name: Bamidele

texts.en:
K. has been selling provisions and drinks for the past five years. She is 33 years old and married with three children. They live in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. 
K. says thanks to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anyikwa

texts.en: C. is into poultry farming and has been in the business for the past two years. He is 34 years old and lives in Ikeja, Lagos State, Nigeria. He is requesting the loan of N160,000 to purchase more chickens to enable him meet his customers demands. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to sell

loans.name: Ngy

texts.en:
Ngy C., 28, operates a food shop in Phnom Penh City for an income US$10 per day. C. and her husband have no children. Her husband is motor-taxi driver usually providing transportation services at the nearby markets.

C. wants to take a loan US$1,000 to expand the inventory of her food-selling business. She is optimistic that she will be able to generate more income with her business when she invests more money into it.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and meat to make food for sale

loans.name: Saera

texts.ru: Камолова Саера проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 30 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Саера более 8 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует одеждой. Ей в этом также помогает ее муж. Клиентка просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Saera K. lives in the Tursun-Zoda region. She is 30 years old, married and has three children. Saera has been in the retail business for more than eight years. She has a vendor spot on the market where she sells clothing. Her husband is helping her with this. The client is asking for a loan to increase her sales and turnover.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales and turnover

loans.name: Ti

texts.en: Ti P., 42, wants a loan of $800 US to run a business selling clothes for her daughter. She has been involved in farming and producing Cambodian traditional cakes for sale since 1980. P.’s husband is also a farmer. Moreover, he is a fisherman who usually fishes at the nearby ponds and lakes by his village. They live in Kompong Cham province and have an income of $2 US per day. Together, P. and her husband have five children, most of whom are employed.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Akande

texts.en: O. is 42 years old and married with four children. She sells drinks and has been in the business for five years. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to enable her to meet her customers’ needs. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Mou

texts.en:
Mou S. N., 28, has been involved in her business of selling groceries, gasoline, and providing phone services since 2006 in Kampong Cham Province, making an income US$2.50 per day. She lives with her husband and two young children who have not attended the school yet. Her husband is motor-taxi driver who usually provides his services at the nearby markets in his province and earns US$2.50 per day.

S. N. wants to take a loan of US$1,000 to expand her current business and to buy pigs to raise.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell and to buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Olunowo

texts.en:
E. is 56 years old and married with five children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and drinks and has been with LAPO Microfinance for the past eight months.

E. is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Oshutolu

texts.en:
A. is 53 years old and is the divorced mother of four children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria where she sells all kinds of juices, drinks and table water. She has been in this business for the past twenty years.

A. is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase all kind of drinks and table water to enable her to meet her customers’ demands. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, juice and table water to sell

loans.name: Galimova

texts.ru: Галимова Гулчехра проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 49 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Гулчехра имеет торговую точку у себя на дому. Она в основном торгует продуктами питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 12 лет. Ее муж занимается услугой такси. Клиентка просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
G. Galimova lives in the Tursun-zoda region. She is 49 years old, married and has five children. G. has a vendor spot at her house. She mainly sells food and groceries. She has been doing this type of business for more than twelve years. Her husband is a taxi driver. The client is asking for a loan to increase circulation of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase circulation of goods

loans.name: Shobajo

texts.en: F. is 50 years old and married with four children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria, where she sells drinks and water. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks so as to meet her customers’ demands. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Akua Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jaqueline G. lives in Cotonou, the largest city in Benin. She is married and the mother of one child, a three-year-old boy. Her husband, David Sossou, is a transit officer in Cotonou.

Jacqueline owns a shop in the Vodje neighborhood of Cotonou, where she sells school supplies. She recently opened her own store after working for several years at another store. She is seeking a loan from Alidé to buy more goods. In the future, Jacqueline hopes to start selling various goods besides school supplies in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: To purchase more school supplies for her store

loans.name: Mida

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale et divers, elle vit dans le quartier d’awatamé, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Son stock actuel de marchandise a baissé, voulant se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 1 carton de riz parfumé, 02 cartons de spaghetti, 1 carton de tomate en boîtes de conserve et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who's been selling various food products since 2006. She lives in the Awatamé neighborhood and gets her supply at the grand market in Lomé. Her stock experienced a drop and, eager to resupply, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 1 box of perfumed rice, 2 boxes of spaghetti, 1 box of canned tomatoes, and various other food products. She's married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 1 box of perfumed rice, 2 boxes of spaghetti, 1 box of canned tomatoes, and various other food products

loans.name: Philomène

texts.en:
Philomène S. is married and the mother of four children. Her two oldest children are in the workforce; one is a schoolteacher and the other is a hairdresser. Philomène’s younger children still live at home. Her husband is a tailor.  Philomène lives with her family in Cotonou, the largest city in Benin, which is located on the coast, not far from Nigeria.  In Cotonou, Philomène prepares food at her home and sells it on the street. In Benin, this is a common activity for many women. Philomène sells dishes of pasta, meat, fish, cheese and tofu.  
 
Philomène says her business is going well, but that she needs more supplies. With a loan, Philomène would like to buy corn, peanut oil, condiments, and charcoal for cooking. In the future, she would also like to start selling drinks along with her meals. Philomène hopes that the profits from her business will help support her family. One day, she would like to buy a house of her own.

loans.use: Purchase of meat, fish, cheese, tofu and pasta

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, son mari est un plombier, le revenu de ce dernier ne couvre pas toutes les charges du foyer, pour l’aider elle a entamé le commerce de produits de première nécessité, elle veut agrandir ses marchandises pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Pour cela elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 5 sacs de maïs et divers produits de première nécessité.
texts.en:
Ms. D. is the married mother of two children. Her husband is a plumber, but his income does not cover all their household expenditures. To help him, she has begun selling basic staple goods. She wants to increase her stock in order to better meet the needs of her clients. To this end, she is requesting a loan to buy five sacks of corn and various basic foodstuffs.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic foodstuffs

loans.name: Hounsikpe

texts.en:
Hounsikpe H. lives in Cotonou, the largest city in Bénin. She has five children, all of whom live at home. Two children are in job training and three are still in school. Hounsikpe’s husband, Housedah Fardinah, is a gardener and plants mainly vegetables that he can sell.  

Hounsikpe is food vendor.  She sells a variety of products, including peanuts, powdered sugar and flour along the road.  Hounsikpe buys her goods at the Dantokpa Market, one of the largest open-air markets in West Africa. She started this business with her own money but has taken out two loans from ALIDé to expand her operations. Hounsikpe is seeking another loan from ALIDé to purchase more goods to sell. She would like to have access to more money so that she can sell her goods in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase of peanuts, powdered sugar and flour

loans.name: Dare

texts.en: T. is 49 years old. She is a widow with two children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. T. has a place where she sells drinks, paper soup (an appetizer made from goat meat), goat meat and recharge cards. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and recharge cards. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and recharge cards to sell
